Video Ads Continue Growing

 

Online video ads on long-form content grew by 86% in the fourth quarter, according to FreeWheel. According to co-CEO Doug Knopper, there are currently nine ads per long-form video, which isn't very much compared to TV's 20 ads. Read more on USA Today <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_4pQK7jyezLIANota9_hkbYK598pKNyqoBM4bJ8ZsVCrBTRlOtEUlXRcAHWctO4b4ygNBSVTW3tNxKZjUi8NpohN9B1j875Q9MOdxV7jJIwYb2u3_6zs5qeb1VRgDUjhmkGtkKRAYM8HFNm88yBGkfhQLmEETx98o0D8qs4LkPUNVM11jrrkdjNcP0TQyHUIas-Jxi_YbMUfx2Eb8mn69vbguNC6trypREbBxGOVki0dQ==> .

 

Programmatic B2B

 

Demandbase is adding to its B2B retargeting product. Consumer or business traffic not of interest to B2B sales teams are excluded from programmatic buys. "Five years ago we relied on Click-thru rate, two years ago it was cost-per-lead, and now we rely on actual pipeline acceleration and revenue growth to measure marketing success," said Demandbase customer Nick Panayi, director, global brand & digital marketing at CSC. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_7_u4l21hIPiCVq7Cy2Iv749Eoag915XpEdnpqnaqiOpkPoF4XICqOiKZELpLeQC49raOyNse8AvhnKiLROtZ68BzXubbH7YMWZox4EPf_3z9rJ6ir-cO62TjcFgJbiuNgCeJR3tDj-pSxryfyjHYSQB_3zBa8iUOxuGLGpGENHOeW1x6q1jZSKLSJQNLe40Zy-VXv0J-055kcETQzF10V_XUVAMZyhZ0oYgLKdzfLLfQ==> .

 

Deep Links

 

Criteo, TapCommerce and ActionX are working together to create a best practice guide for deep-linking in apps. "With the acquisition of Ad-X Tracking (see June 2013 story <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_6CIo3cG8g-9jrxUBlR9vALY2mQF_6_k_7o6xAmzymRx95X4tFPvSdMCgXjg36wOtn6ci-UCtGVx9QLvutQGnsaUPg3aB-9WeX3T7xymPdkLCyRjRUDn3PNEBr8OOOx-UT747MPyRyXA9BX-Z-2QsKJwFkak0VQsIMwmUQ_HKM8YPehbA3bAx_KhBt3VPo8xe-FIFmQNZo6SXmR1BN-J9yg-evYc_ai6iM=> ), Criteo quickly recognized the issues with current deep-linking specifications. By providing a set of guidelines, tools and source code we believe app developers will be able to enhance the user experience and increase app engagement," trumpeted Jason Morse, Criteo's VP Mobile. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_7teXd0ct0aUVuinTtJbb9JsBjkSbq_sKdO3NT0RL-d4h3EOvhR1QDPohKqRrbxRxz8PdESg4N1v-uY-Yx0PgVkWCuBR6ynhqrQi5cFoVbfuyjiGNxfP6VWJ3_Sa1Pxj4nhBqcC7BWSQ-cDii31d58jN7zi9awsfDLjUCIP6LGQs7E8C3wX6p62ts27LuqTx6yQeTa_oeLWCFM4u_IYddjPPvdE9dVIVsh4wheHHbr0VN3yTcToH0qZRkpawp5Yw-ZL1AQRRzrqe_8VmEbkUhvcIfsnggACbMKo0kZ0XJE5u6fS2DMHS0vPaxlztZMXB9k=> .

 

Consulting Cloud

 

Deloitte has chosen NetSuite as its cloud of choice, giving access to the ERP side of the business to its clients. "NetSuite's demonstrated/time-tested, customizable solution gives us the platform to answer the growing demand for cloud ERP which we have seen from businesses of all sizes," said Paul Clemmons, principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_46qtQjeqhYDZiMztzL5zI1mLzlQBybJ179U712yJosC3Hc1YjivaRTKTouhW7LrgiEclCkIchUaEcTtiB5NYZ3LsyVdG4j8PEbEOII3kQe5k_ksGaIsSXsjvCNpt-nxuFZF8d12pdGPrVszHBpItUty9m_mJRq5Ts=> .

 

Intelligent Marketing

 

Gartner analyst Jake Sorofman urges marketers not to get distracted by the shiny new things and instead focus on making balanced decisions. Sorofman and fellow analyst Andrew Frank developed the "Intelligent Brand Framework," which shows marketers how to identify strengths and weaknesses in their thinking. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001_t4fGVPMf_7bG_-_eoJ05gJtAdUvJGzddQatThpu6E_7HT995lGvA1aWSPgoX3BfVU7ospXGmROx4v1VHds35iYBtW9YIknQMchg6kffGxf37p4K1MUINBZknNc0XQWRlUbWpTpPDqwDA5qlgSi9E3zrWRQFkOEcy3UEF2rCMYtRgVLfJmztABXj0U8yyj-nV5ptePAiiIXO1IoBX3K3saE1xr2OE4eKhrVKZIyGWB8=> .

*	Display Ad Glasnost: Google And Russia's Yandex Connect On RTB <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGm2s0JdPaZv8QdFHjI1n3CDxjDwVKgm_OrE0G12fbYKxF8GSK6p47smlpY_GfsxNKpubr8-nU_JGHE5PtrST_JDtEeQD8webtGhUPOuXa6x4SQAHt8qpKc08a954QnEr-n-xCOjgN_y9CDTMfWI9BxEKtInCyM-wC3NshduALGTxJnuxdxdn0pqli1eY2VM3aU0pFT0VSyXExhZsiqLME1PurkNNCe5js=>  "The perception of Yandex and Google is mostly of competition," said Vladimir Isaev, Yandex's international media relations executive. "They're the strongest competitors in Russia in terms of search and it's weird when two competitors find a way to collaborate, but RTB is an example of how it can be done in a win-win situation for marketers, advertisers, and publishers..." (visit AdExchanger)

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGCp6t9LzgZWWlShOFyiMkOxRoen60OMuQLlH2xUpoc60nF0qkPw1YXTdFPXFo6dNwz9nLqBEOMYJq8yG--Mc0488WHRZDr16LV_uIEdsgkKstwYv5GoyRNQAb7Xa07wGo=> .

 

Search Expansion


Twitter is adding promoted accounts to search results as the company seeks new revenue streams. Although mobile is a huge part of Twitter's strategy, its fourth-quarter earnings were disappointing. The new advertising option is data-driven. "We automatically select relevant search queries for presenting Promoted Accounts based on an advertiser's targeting choices, so no additional action is required for your business to access this capability," Twitter product manager Nipoon Malhotra wrote in a blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGeJu7XA6LXTuccAGsDprjIvOd7IXajkXKdkSvDc3KqQk2dlRSlmksOpOZyY-fJVcHu6UOHRC_5YAQtNiQ_jH7u0G2m-5MEntu6U5hftWlGWNgnvMxUdp8tXkSk_Y8pbLn-Ud1cVbkDjnqSXLpGtR-W19DSe0M2supTqpcxjxPObw==> .


Ad Tax Advocate


IAB President and CEO Randall Rothenberg is publicly speaking out <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRG4LfVkfeldxLCf2nHMntkPrNB12nVgSX2B2QTPa2qmftebryKbIuhMxFRX5WMsPRY2DxN1OvcWyIdHzo1kXICr6f4q64yF30WX_-S2Y7pugKolCy-nFzLN>  against tax reform that takes away deductibility of advertising. "In a U.S. economy still struggling to grow, the last thing to consider is a change in the tax deductibility of advertising expenditures. Advertising is the engine of consumer demand; it brings people into showrooms and stores, and generates the economic activity that creates new jobs," he said.


Percolating WPP


In the FT, Emily Steel announces that agency holding company WPP Group has signed on for a minority stake in and partnership with content marketer Percolate. She writes, "Marketers are pouring dollars into creating articles, videos, photos and other content for the web and social media, as consumers increasingly ignore standard digital ads. The trend is especially prevalent on mobile, where traditional banner ads have largely flopped." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFofRC5eZe1bCo3evtj7YOwM0k2VSe-SVac9DjS17PDLSgzuObUuqqbF1RUSEPCHu5AJ_mLU9KLmdzryov997CVg6LfzX2Jco27p645XGtEx-sufWkq1MW39G4Myyfk54RXHZRF1pBmJsQUrAtZZTB2AruRkMhm1fpuEaMtMxG0zXLhSuvn0GDN> . And read the release on the new partnership <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFWD4zbLQ7X68WNKNGg_d_70qbnAKgdUk5sfLSY3bxzTMwoB5cBHU0vzEl9e3wT8OAATVq1ABn1_oJiaER7J40ICbyjdWZuDO7mx2Kc6Izk6vBBB_KMcwRoBlwoqkssBOofVSCIrBU3evGC75QgQtN3hx2fnP5LXeT5EeFYKC4rWdH9yvMUXQBBzf03yNpiijLETsfM1mUemcQ8MP4ylH1HXrngs5ULdtPyOw_a2mBjiwCNPsUFmK_m> . WPP's investment in Buddy Media cleared $50 million when Buddy Media sold to Salesforce in 2012, adds Steel.


Glass Ads


Image recognition and augmented reality startup Blippar <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGOWnnxliwRLq39PJl7umFfAFPcI_-eq-e8yp3nCmtHhcys8Jc4axYa_yJzUhydOhL5GV1a5GVB3RVzTr03RZ61B8KxhU48t4teAgf-H9aA4A==>  is developing its smartphone app for Google Glass, according to TechCrunch. The app gives users the opportunity to scan products and then it serves up interactive ads. Blippar claims that its new Glass app can scan and recognize products, images and faces. The company has worked with big brands such as Coca-Cola, Disney, Sony, P&G and Unilever. "Glass today can be likened to what mobile phones were in early nineties," said CEO Ambarish Mitra. "We at Blippar anticipate that if Glass reaches a couple million users in its first year of launch, it will be a good business opportunity for us to develop in the space." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IREpxNZFQXLHFh-6F3_VgvTYSwp6dOcQ3U9IQ3Rda577S3gnIssX5sdyRrj2c03yh6FzVecqcm_e9mVtZo8ahN2Jb0O2DKZr7i32NNfhGyQrWadJXIyqcm4-mkX5XLGWwfTMTaj1XzxkDhEwxm6QBjuDHUFapQSkiSleEzDOawd27r3jDpezDO5fdsSRI2vd__O7oGNlFGX99PuDxbKJ0ndKxiDHMuYzMKo=> .


New Metrics


The idea of "responsive page design," in which a user views a stream of information, is tailored to our increasingly mobile consumption and will likely challenge the current display metrics. Doug Weaver, founder and CEO of Upstream, ponders what interactions will be counted when gauging performance on sites using this new design form, especially when the user has more control over what content is viewed. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRHWHdRjSQI4NVXb0CJmmjECZy8Vjqx17Mo1YiFPhrIQz-T0c0CdCgQEhimffdcrGcc8IXgaBMayx_T-cWxaDghkBhquIiIVPQErryTdE_yEBzvYnng-DFnC2cIjXYavqpc=> .

Join Top CMOs and CEOs at The LiveRamp Summit Feb 27th <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRE7Tw_2jyVR7uHl1x6Osk7IJjegKIZXc4ysvlkfvjpnLrc5h4sUQmBAc_zFoWXvctZ2BN6xu-b0k1C_8ujBgmqPUhUfyivvyGdE1vpSZ6ZX_IPR6Q17YN2X8jiJwVXzok4=> .

  _____  


Brand Tagging


Facebook is helping brand pages gain more reach organically by allowing posts to be tagged and then served up to the audience of the tagged page. The example given was for a Bleacher Report article that tagged two athletes, which can then be served to those athletes' fans. According to Digiday, Facebook will decide whether the tag is relevant and therefore warrants being shared with the other audience. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFlz_aFYrYqM03z2ArXqRVtaZznSitZPCjGsseWqi8UloZG4LF5uH68KtfYPYTEDFMll3Lv8XVUNwsRvsi3OZDIlSMhKRY-kyN2NM7ENwJJzWBWb2oVK3n_wK6ISuyIF7YJJEbZXhUFl25B5vjh4u5j> .


Marketing Moves


Yahoo's chief marketing officer, Kathy Savitt, just got a handful of new responsibilities after Chief Operating Officer Henrique de Castro's firing. Savitt will now oversee news and video, which have both been big on Yahoo's radar as Marissa Mayer attempts to turn the company around. Revenue is still in decline, as The Wall Street Journal notes, even as Yahoo makes big efforts to attract advertisers. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGNRYc4C0DwOFtg69wrJQwM7_59M4LnYO0w-8vCaIsszkw4tuOEeKw-FEYCLZ8XMqvGbCb0FFjsjlbTtqQhmW_fCBW3wcqE_pteR2K32da2XidIn5A7WNH8LwGJ_0NwbjfbX9LIUyxcHqCfA_I1ByO53Fh9YOFYRGteQA9ryJTGQ-utyfZ15cBvn1BX4hEfW5U=>  (subscription).


BI Comeback


Business intelligence is experiencing a resurgence of interest now that tons of data is flowing through the Internet every millisecond. Data is bridging gaps between the technology side of business and the execution side, as GigaOM reported. PricewaterhouseCoopers predicts a continued interest in BI through M&A. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRHKl9vKj8R5f3vnCTDdnNqkt9A4JoLc_cfZ7euQV_b39nsAn9pc59hC67R9IZ83NuISajkKYm1fomsBYWHK3ax3DNq4OKUlBY02vd0QAa7kc--TuAmPbzf3cyQbMorj1ABBmEFz-P1n_D-Q2Y1HxegLHZHE3NMsL6paq1wmJSMu3QCEHBGAFj1xZMlsIaL1O03dzArqbavcjQ==> .

 

Supply, No Demand


According to CNN's international digital VP and GM, Peter Bale, advertisers are not stepping up with responsive ads to match publisher supply. "There is still a tremendous amount to be done in advertising or advertising-like products. We have a substantial 'specials' business which is sponsored editorial content - which I'm proud of as it keeps the line very effectively between church and state - but offers very engaging, powerful experiences that happen to be sponsored and which are made possible by that," Bale told The Drum <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFaaZRx0z3ZmVn2_7K_xZM0a5NlD8_E_SUkIk_JCsqAfzIOKzatoUoYrKw461TpXFUgKma8kAxVAFajKwpmyowy5AuKXDdfxF46IrKes91gwEhQH0wOH-y9qLmx0prabWTaGUQrff-ar3oLSDLOfYSLB7zhNUFFhP51kb3hE4M7UpIJ48D2Ugg1n-bhStfz6WQM7gfnG3j7wMAOfehRdAjMENSw7HxK5SSuHtpGrYVVXqri83CcnuZ_> .


Size Matters


The size and duration of an ad trumps relevancy and freebies in terms of what consumers consider important about a mobile ad, according to a PricewaterhouseCoopers survey. PWC polled approximately 1,000 consumers about their attitudes toward mobile advertising and 57% said the size and duration of a mobile ad was the most important part, followed by relevancy (56%) and freebies (40%). "Mobile devices have unique properties and marketers need to think of better ways to reach consumers," said John Swadener, strategy consulting director at PWC. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFLH4fysBmiBZ5m9B5xM-UyuXAULnnVrFSYhAOjTHnSXL6qgQshQ_tTMJ0AUzQFn8jOYm8U6swsfcQ9MDietF043S6jFWdvVXPLNI4wpECjj0pWD7MJPTolXIsqAs9DvIU8cdHWw5iJkt9OucXgAhzwSAgdHxoulBS75OwQ9C0Ad8E0n5xK4Gmvv5LEyaMjLY5fPANbaNC5C1LWJ3iqDB1jaz-inDzkx5IOXk-lkxFhx7L1ItMkJeMnmebUB_tEEi5eJcmgrPl5xqKBX7ma7JVKqwsgXOQuZX65DaThIMT5thsVrFPBrZuaEQ2qKVCwLrjq0HW-c0X3XA==> 


More Mobile


A Rubicon Project survey <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGNwrQU9u0C0F1US3BEwr_m7RGHrpllSlpJ3xvwJlHeKzh2xzgtrpocdEBfRUBWHHBQiEHGx58fQCk3F1G3NAkfZeairYZjVOMxvpwFqbQjMss0FU3e__H1>  showed that agencies plan to double their spend on mobile advertising this year, and 90% plan to do so through a DSP. "We're seeing increasingly sophisticated methods of buying with most buyers surveyed establishing private marketplaces, or planning to do so, and many using data in their campaigns," said Jay Stevens, general manager, international, for the Rubicon Project. Read the report <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IREM1GNAkZBXJK_fbbh-5VJcapjyhIzUjMTvRR2doKEu-UFQ3b_kk7tvhsOB-8WW7INSZ2JGJnEPUOGZuhqfFhiDZB5oKFtbe4vXsiE7mWGKLfnTJenGmQ3HgKnIY1rjZHPIVdY0vzYtEdis871R-2PN>  (registration required). Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRGWI3crkUJ8YG6jbP6vLvDHVdfds_prqhMf2vA2bsUa7tVyt2OF-4OeSxWYjtnFI1wjMFn5wzYqq1b12Wh2fXbmioW4QeNrOU66IRT4kD_l2mjtGlQen_srzTI7ODvsjN4=> .


Investing In India


EBay is injecting more money into India-based shopping site Snapdeal, which could ultimately lead to a buyout, according to Re/code. Although in some ways Snapdeal competes with eBay India, Devin Wenig, president of eBay Marketplaces, doesn't seem concerned. "When we make an investment and are cooperating with a third party like Snapdeal, we hope to be successful and hope eventually we can take the next step," Wenig said. "We have a history of making minority investments where at times it works well and we take the next step and end up acquiring the target." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jljMeZA0IRFQvqB1wlz5y4WgltbY4aJv1o66TfU4nB242h4jiyt0flIYdSDMXxd9Nc5gX8lfuMmicjsdS3CFix26Xu9U_n_1zBGgHHTd4lPsJFW8CbgOw8Ur85f7BxtoNdkfO2-SAB8Afbb1mNI2Pk4WHizRTwRylgyBgyC1reQro4lvU9Pp64qKCo42uLgUGWzrC-HR_gjN_1VYwv-BuXiDoaB6_tj9g8BE2e9kRZE=> .

Takeover Target


An article in Bloomberg explores the possibilities that ad tech firm Conversant (was ValueClick Media) may be an attractive takeover target. Bloomberg's Laura Lorenzetti paraphrases Wedbush analyst Shyam Patil, who says, "Conversant could struggle to find a buyer for the whole business since its collection of assets covers a broad range of services[.] Prospective purchasers may only want specific pieces of the company, such as the higher-margin affiliate business or proprietary media technologies." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsJBvSy1KYMzcQnvBifZQuRrAtPyhdiLLtnjwmiWm3n92jKgW2VOOXdau_IOBioQQ_2CzHqLh2wejE4rW59AgQfCEFKMS1fyjh6D7k3wyuJxjgx8vpSiv0qCdNSQsLKgMnmg-PuDkGzAM8r5mYEUpe-wTI7Lb0sZEj4GMetAzQJIldSlPCPsQuqLaKUoADASddV3HaahbIDsNIwskgw-iIyk> . At yesterday's market close, Conversant was valued at $1.7 billion <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsK979eF6d6h9MWm9W9b1FN3_KCbRAHXqyrBS_eM_A26WrxcZSSnat7met9SkBcI7cK5YOCfEU6HtfWRaHvNBWnsD4vP6LUwD3ImvsYCPf3Amb3RLTLqWozZX3h5kITx8GUsJPa2ds0FJv8ws9Ut2YYK> .


Programmatic Mobile Abroad


Millennial Media is expanding its mobile ad exchange, MMX, internationally to more than 20 countries. Along with the expansion, Millennial is also offering up what it says is more robust targeting, including cross-device campaign opportunities through its partnership with AppNexus. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsJ5OjhuCRvdKEIWVU6uRITHtGY7fGFf8EfqYhCjI6cfuvuQ7rrOeWMyOhxO68poRbPIjvE4icwL32sGM1vdCgsTxflTHTnC4eGAQjjYm1OXGJKq4nFuVtesl7SwnZvHDmXhrsGTZrdHR4iN3C_BkOFA5_EBcaQrmcc=> .


Cultural Trading Desk


A new trading desk from agency The Cipher Group will focus entirely on the multicultural market, according to an article in Ad Age. Although the audience would be available through open exchanges, it would take a lot more work on the advertisers part to find it - hence the need for specialization. "The question is, do multicultural agencies want to do all of this work themselves?" Charles Cantu, CEO of Huddled Masses, told Ad Age. "Usually the answer is no." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsLY7lyxGp0McOrq-eDqFDNOkUdpHCm4MXUprsMKXUUgEYQQW1t9otC3sSGON8X_3jUxa69emOqwdxvXcoGo3VIjFWV3-DjfCxNX7JFN0u6zaATVKcJA7Z4lcf_zII7QZE9-Bg2NO5dP81zlNfsaSLukhInHwy3Ovj_EbdXryrphf3I193Plh2u58eGoQDiIElT7Pngxyx0XHg==> . Huddled Masses will partner with Cipher and use its MediaMath technology to implement the trading desk.


Self-RTB


When consumers block ads websites lose out on advertiser dollars, but consumers who are opposed to ads still want great content. Nicholas Kruchten, head of product engineering at Datacratic, has worked up a complicated but potentially effective solution that allows both parties to win. The basic idea would be to have the user pay for their impression and instead of seeing an ad they will see the picture of their choice. Considering most ad impressions cost a few cents per person, this wouldn't cost the consumer very much. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsLSEiH9oNien2KM8e3IvmMr87ygPHXSf4zm-7uu9XswGfLwrgHmWeRnO-l5Tj0Lh7gwDDidvx7iBhp57et8jRghHLmUCQx16CCiWdqprmmfSCN-vpcIrwIyH8VGqEG_jqo3cDQC3vxxlQ4kQbYR2nkF01YN4HJjiWkldEzjpOs8BKYqqV3eDs4gapgZ1kdtprDVA7int6NT7g==> .


Profit Margins


China online media company Sina's Q4 earnings far surpassed analysts' expectations, thanks in part to its microblogging service Weibo - and ads! - according to Businessweek. "Sina reported a solid set" of results, wrote Alicia Yap, an analyst at Barclays, in a report. "The margin improvement was mainly attributed to the enhanced ability of Sina to scale its advertising business profitably." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsKpvCXCzTcyExXgd2aIhRmt-qydebwIwN2HdGNqcPYHibSHqGcu-C1MS8UNWUma4WBFXEVMFexI6_kyZrE3kEPJJGsaYfdIzUMj5V8c_K_Ri7M82YGW3dJNyXuP1kOkZ2XqC3vl3fsvcxETkLthEP2cEGBFIxwC1ePNnlmRbNcZQtYwnTPJN8Vt1ilAYFMI7adZJmDUmxk9zGayi7MAPiZfgVkljRhUfuU=> .

Mobile Beyond Facebook


HasOffers wants its customers to know there is a world of mobile advertising outside of Facebook, which alone accounts for 25% of mobile ad spend. The company, which was recently dropped from Facebook's mobile measurement program, called out 25 companies that it thinks are doing big things for mobile advertising. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsIkYzDl2qLpUCovloNzC4TDz4_h1XyIiIc039qyHdpEgocoj6ip6LvdAX__cSHKUI5uvZSKTX0nXC9saVFhFWFPQyNE0HUenwIov-RSWztgMeZ0Sszd7nWdaq9cgT6-NDakGfXV0oNGXWs4prRSpXGKySaMmlMmkMF9THfvg-GNYw==> .


Video Reach


Ooyala will help Univision distribute its online video content cross-platform to grow the reach of UVideos and Univision Deportes Network. Ooyala is integrated with multiple platforms, including Adobe Pass and Freewheel. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsJ2K9ngcWNvAjJjYgTvj2C1mmbewAo4aBBe9xQUgHJT5dJljob8Qw1YTWnsatgSKB9NgLa_zrVNGRISReG5zhy2KsapkGFyJNTLs3u0JabuGkB3Y9KVOi4IbSgz723y9eHrTDxuzZjM1sky5Pnpc_1t7l5bIK9pvxV6kXv0FqWou4sJOFKg1WlglkSiWl7eQCsZIkbElsgdmg==> .


Mobile SEM


AdGooroo, a Kantar Media company, added mobile search data to its SEM tool, according to a press release. "The addition of mobile search data provides AdGooroo clients with a complete picture of the search marketing landscape," said Richard Stokes, founder and CEO of AdGooroo. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsKM4G-Q6x12RcTYV7t6-CdwVBkdzjjIjAg6ndaLMji0lX2nygB_SPWTUAqyyEhvJQC2sMR-IKyQfW01qiEqIJ8Lt-jwTvAblHuZJzPp3vR4RlolqPIuZQpfE7qV7WkATatRom4CHZnz43udCjyGEuy7WuJPxD6dNz-sUrWvqndRyboNba69J7SHsGpakwKcCPPqhIIr_iNBVLl4SHo_F5Qi5EcoEqbPv5yg2oPsX60pXHKJ-hVQYQeR9KwrTw-0RrA=> .


GRP Argument


TubeMogul's managing director in Europe, Nick Reid, echoes the GRP argument for extending TV spend to online video in a piece in The Drum. Gross rating points (GRPs) allow planners and buyers to think of online video the same as TV, and he adds, "The consumer doesn't look at engaging with video specifically through the media channels of TV or desktop, they think about video as video." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001pO6kFf1CZsIaz1uM3zjv-MAb5kzy7r5JMD9KIe8pP6_-Kjte_ShV5mtlE6KAL-tKlEms0NAqz24jcTcu_IUoNYJ2JtlIJ7ZOO8YFBA3j1FNao6Z8awE2l4Vm8LVANuaH-YUqsjVZ1lNWuF5k1L6pV66_vmpd9NWSWoSIkYS3TSFJN3n6oV4VbZl140tesmnKUuQSPiff_l5b4XToRgizRvEEGiFoAfqzMmGVBBz1wqc=> .

Local Exchange


Google says it's offering a helping hand to local publishers who may not have the ability to take on programmatic alone. A new private exchange <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmoAi8x6stfwmHaG0w1-TjxR6FirqbSdGnGhjeLUdbif-zYa9sv9kYpWnzp4bfANZ53mQx7pz8tMQ71EGLSNv-KhrN8MygTpqbZorIQo8wNX8ZMGGT8wMgP8cBJZOlZ3-kit2-8eBVH2Ssmc-0dBE2jb-RNzucSvOyV-5Pq0LL--HJ77gQ4RSb8H-7WWG-TQ0L-m1Z2F5cCJog==>  has launched in a deal with the Local Media Consortium <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmr5mAdKQjrlc9dsGO70PAZ0fECOxhJkUaqbtJ84d4ku5_8hBSBOLPQjGdRG6xvVwu-o_7Q1cedMBRskhJ9kZwXL0Hewj-aa9VWZHsMMe8_jszpgR3ZAb1-UIhQnArdPcSI=> , which comprises more than 800 newspapers and 200 broadcast stations. The participating publishers will also have access to the DoubleClick platform and AdSense. "What we've seen over last several years was a rise in realization by quality brands that they want to be associated with other quality brands," Richard Gingras, head of news and social products at Google, told Forbes <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmoNKrka3MVld0lYHgWd9ldChAqYJ-dsCNlYTL8zkuJ_rgmLx9jbuFCWa3tze9F9DsX4DcevpqiRb6xti-A4Gb8dCqhLu2_6j9DxScGaIezM1FJZHSnpZrS59IbrcvJfLfpfL-bgjUyLtA1tj-OiDjaJm9CJWXGDMb7Tn-tMZ3qorbdtxzzqWMDeK-lS-4SzzW7CnPCsvEmWdUiwEGv2YjVC95Zk45qSREjIUJDTN0YdtqO5_yz4Mv4g> . "The real question was how could we extend that opportunity to brands in local markets that don't have the same wherewithal to make these kinds of sales."


Publisher Perspective


The programmatic ball is often in the publisher's court and Meredith is taking steps to make the most of automated technologies. Adweek caught up with Chip Schenck, its VP for programmatic sales and strategies, who gave the scoop on the integration with traditional sales. His method: "We want to incentivize our sellers to be as much of the conversation as they have to be." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrqCyLGbbsvJ4C9X3Ed2qRtqF_pAPXgiKlf3ReOxz4-1ZCVmKUUaCmE-yryvpIq4S_oHYy-NvSJz1bM1qrf4KihKARSu_GLt83Hzp0VooK9V5AMW_6HyqG_YOF8VcaGTS-rRD2huXD6swZHS7Lf3Ht7sMOlH5Q_NxHtEtXhA_bqMc4g12iw1DguIELJtjsJrXQukwVwZ217MJkN7rBl5ftv> .


Twitter In Hollywood


Twitter is thinking beyond TV for its Amplify program <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrnLCrd1pnnWQ_IM_IoRlg7_g3zvk5aNkcxGZIdXnQya3GekstIiKX0vJKJfRfJXTdV_s9ugIP8VfxeuIAe66WwHintAi2oyT7ImA5dg2JHHa0d0RoUj8Xi0IU2Iir-vIRjKxueXRHzww2JOZTXHaV2dAj_TvSqtcu8mPopPYge65ziSiLyOa9yTd7kelG5Xejotk1bFZdKpSkJxoRVxh98>  and now wants to integrate its second screen tie-in capabilities to movie theaters. "It's a big audience and it's big reach, and we'd like to find a partner who wants to literally own this and be associated with it day in and day out," said Cliff Marks, NCM Media Networks' president of sales and marketing, in an interview with Ad Age. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmqlUoQbw88m9gp2CkUDtq8mD4bca8LX_x5uzTnLgFjGyw4UxFpnlUVuf5oBwxU5VGNrFnKXjnOFUCOywIVdkjmKL7D9HBOEXJB5l1TDDOaWwUo5p1JXV8wO115JWMiVYm1LfIU9La5y-NsApO55saCgGTcU0u1QBp35N5Pm-iLhfUAzPNtTaK7Rzq35Pxg39kClmqLezh-Eig==> .


Multichannel Exchange


A year after Opera Software spun off its mobile advertising, content distribution and monetization businesses into Opera Mediaworks, the company has launched two new products: Opera Mediaworks Ad Exchange (OMAX) 2.0 and AdMarvel for Ad Networks. OMAX 2.0 is "all about giving publishers more control over their inventory," said CEO Mahi de Silva. AdMarvel for Ad Networks was previously available on a limited basis, but it is now generally available. "We've opened the AdMarvel platform to all our clients with a full data support team to assist them," de Silva added. Here's more info about OMAX 2.0 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrMID_9V8LO6_MQ1eTFzK8-71jZArvspyTLXPrpCtZKueXqjTjtZkk_RePK3WhN7b1XuD24kgRE09lJvK_WE3pouBwm89S92-lTvpXZL9F1VpUhZ7PfQMBfaxSEw65BPJnZW7YinXG8c8W-hK-pB7NVP-3TMum5xy5Z9v71T03hV65lzS5Rsu32>  and more on AdMarvel for Ad Networks <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmr76goF-gH-zVf_E1y4ESGiBBfGrDwTuEtUgGyv1DULgAQQhRuoWsmPqh6WsO8KPk89Qajp3NGvcmKDLNqCRyykFG7F5g8n5QYyyDK46sRUOUXXztHzXtxjLS7czsYI_3dtUyaXW08AU0uFJK76EOqxAVYgIr0wPvdHElDxluquy2dD8TAL-wV3Jhi9pDXsb-A=> . The more hooks the better seems to be the mantra for some mobile ad tech companies.


New Money


A year after launching its cross-channel ad management platform, AdStage is growing and launching new products <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmpcVSznUJW9AV2VGkppkqBpa01fIeGslmY6oyv2P5eFV6jBGSENnuATZNAxGltsaXpz8bfMsRwgL6CJbzBjxWV_FHH0JjNA-B1oLdXMIEZEN_8V8KzU3fH_2Ye6d3HpPWE2vhdCSu24XIZebX7Bq3Wq17YAm1Oo_X3iZZO1pzlV8ZMUx37cxGyVGIYVmF5Y1FRdfCep1laMldlQ9-OdNjR_TRSkE4-TzNlIQFUoGltq9FVqcvs73RF4fTWqz18GGiQJIqlPhMXZeXQWEDuax6ghOrdRXHRPUtYvMQN-tPOedQ==> . Helping that growth is a $1 million round of funding led by Digital Garage, as well as a partnership program. "The industry has historically punished 'ad tech' companies because they were really agencies masquerading as tech companies," said Sahil Jain, CEO and co-founder of AdStage. "We're ushering in a new era of ad technology and using this new capital to pour fuel on that fire." More coverage on TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmpZhHwvD1ipUaESzTXhHbX8MP1aKCe63L3JL4YszKy_uvgNE7C7gRppdAXYL-6mxtGTuMk61VEyP7_7D2HpbcOH7NeUmDCQNqQx4WvDURUpMZLswOJSu_BURksyiFYl3sH1YDszdgm4z5kEuiP2CSqCTHEp0qWgU50=> .

The New Yahoo


Marissa Mayer spent a year trying to rebrand Yahoo at the expense of advertising, but now a vision is starting to emerge for the struggling tech company, according to a New York Times profile. The focus right now appears to be "native." The company still struggles with revenues, however. "We made a deliberate decision to invest, and that ultimately caused our operating income to decline somewhat," Mayer said. "But we're motivated by making the right decisions for the company to get us on a long-term path for healthy growth." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrBp5gE0iddk_efYOXoVXpXKbwBVW2LhcVsdWzzPXSWDbxSbRnmuStssXe5xCj4Qb5G-pywn_NNWzDojIaY4VAt8gbxmNmqPF5iNmsA1JBwlFbJLXX9tu8KGVqanYk97E_EEpQo8IwRYmtBU7oqylTXpKgRiQ66CiprxUCpaCX9o-1GW3zWbwTUkFUzvo4owVGiwJYgQjLoGBfTgo65yZ6PZQvCXxlCyeUcglHSiKFGgQ==> .


Programmatic Branding


Joe Weaver, who in recent years has spearheaded Mindshare's trading desk unit, has left the WPP agency for a role with TubeMogul, advocating the branding potential of programmatic video. At Mindshare his team built programmatic launch pads for Kimberly-Clark and others. LinkedIn. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmoxZIW-3e0sq6HtKIPtNTacm3mFkMYlTLK2WwoBLz3S7Pi05NnFBWMfAuwJMbgilEsFfkeaaiGX9XFHQu3wL8XMbKk63vTbBqfoRBjG7PP9UB6Tg2zIDPCtz3EvtFM43d6uZFalym_ChtChxIZtgz5TatlVn_M4G4A2aAvZSfJKmaND4xh1GHLDntLTwvfUxepFgA5O-2qOtJ4sUf_PtVJAztSC_GoRpcbHhlm996DRIfrFxI2MI28rUhhb44CHBxujN1GbOwJ8zbkl2JB9tw6oPES1TjUj_s8HpeFdtIXRV269iEIzZFOSn1eHlfScern4MYY4NDmKETvKs1K839n1ljCypoOnwm__3yqGiIM4KFz2H5B3swKpCnxNzWNLqTU=>  And MediaBistro <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrenwzwcOOh8GLWh3v7epDeF0zjTFXJTz_5BzAT1A0RH1Uk3hIzyvPOmQqDqp1f4d6ygmFxdXmg6e441RnEyHTSLhP3Rs3dBxQfBj5qkmNvjWZjAiv3DjD6XSLdOOchKF99fXQ_QGqpIpzL3Ydd4eZKQ2sDC0JeOTHBlLnYDUWfPg==> .


Apple's Way


In the world of tech acquisitions, Apple prefers smaller buys and acquihires over major deals, as The New York Times outlined. "They're pre-emptively investing in areas where they think there are opportunities to grow," said Ben Bajarin, a consumer technology analyst for Creative Strategies. "Without doubt Apple is a bit more focused and lean in their approach and disciplined about the things they buy." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001MBeA0SA3bmrl4EQN2L5xG8_Bs7qdGZSF7lAkXe_aJOWbb4hPCeeiAgnoOZlPmkktqQY6FbtbE3pwSuIypiQ5zxkni6LkU5Nge5nPNQLrUyONinCIGU-kcKY7yIOA-lYcMOMigAkA6pRri-dSsE6wiesCc40RH40OQnhL0P-pcPMLbDc0j24DbXxLsk9-tW1vndEqdJ06Hs_K7vqDP3Yl22iYBQXE-RenDA8W89OevWA=> .

Report: Oracle Adds BlueKai


Business Insider reports that BlueKai may be getting acquired by Oracle for $400 million. BI's Nicholas Carlson and Julie Bort write, "Marketing tech is shaping up to be the next big trend in enterprise tech spending and Oracle CEO Larry Ellison wants to dominate it. Companies spend nearly $4 trillion a year on technology, mostly through their IT departments." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNwuU4k9A5aAFOhJP3R1J54nnmYnNqfX1JqoQVK4X8UZdsaECIhzkcxT86kcwPpDBBQ_bHg5qxNJjnVZwHc4DLGNZ867qATG1iOPA3D9Z_M_DSJe8dX2OQhhDCN4FxHXMFJ0Oz9D49lGB785u-CXbVj_uixH-p97L9E=>  This acquisition would be the next in a line of Oracle purchases, such as marketing automation company Eloqua in December 2012 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNyBjZ7OcxGa5V50ch-wiy_8MO7u09zwuecFSEBG-0EVflETum4lE2gB6JgSpfJIXjwxZLqj9BbJGnEZbBAWRa4b-oIhiOzIs3Z9W4iIY621tI6Sbl_F-arhPyVWzaTZLyEn13_Rp11NikREkQxDuKSolF3rUVjfvY0=> .


Amazon's Video Move


Amazon is putting itself in direct competition with online video ad companies, striking a deal with Geico to repurpose TV ads for pre-rolls on Amazon pilots. "We're testing and learning. It's early days, and we're looking at all different video formats. We're focused on creating a great experience for our customers," Amazon VP Lisa Utzschneider said. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNxPxbReoWQ_plkDVNEkEeDzK-K49B1uWYt1ER8X2aZaTyWCgKrTCvAXxmmVX923xWo4sMWkInQkPUfNcY1HWJD_6giY1K6xNsHR0lOH8QylR2fBuhIHE_IElbmLpqyCgHiCAVNLjE7wkHCzAV4Vn2-QE8bJhiYDjWvHQ8AEq5PGt8W8tW7quimAwkbD1_YeHDY=> .


Mobile Brand Safety


Nexage released a new product, Nexage Protect, that is designed to provide mobile publishers and advertisers with brand safety measures. The need for mobile brand safety solutions is growing quickly, said Stephanie Layser, MailOnline's yield optimization manager. "With mobile becoming a bigger part of our bottom line, there are going to be more issues where fraudsters try to game the system and we need to have partners like Nexage that can monitor against that," Layser told AdExchanger. Nexage Protect includes ad screening controls, malware detection through a partnership with The Media Trust, block lists and other features. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNykKc5QvrHdrKMY2QKEfCobn4zYx83_IRQ4tDy0yQWCELnoI4g5tphdKLBI3IhNe1Ir4u6jlJzFVIUG7wpZk47rZdL3UxJat-NFYzeiHBgEPovA_Anqk9Ym4DrI-nl3GH3jM5WYMi60h-qmu1OTFfUpL23t0pub-FrQgQIzrD0fnqCLqCG0glcskOOMcVdUNnA=> 


Healthy Ads


After the seemingly unending challenges of the past, advertising appears to be driving better results at health portal WebMd. CEO David Schlanger said on a call with Wall Street analysts, "Our positive fourth-quarter and full-year 2013 results were driven by our advertising and sponsorship business, which benefited from an improved macro industry environment and our focused efforts to become a more customer-centric and efficient organization. After declines in 2012, we finished 2013 with 10% revenue growth and 68% growth in adjusted EBITDA." Read the transcript on Seeking Alpha <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNw_LHYkPvp8DQhETtNpNLmZcLYGE0LphsueQKtmha2II7vkaIRF6ooQ3KE59LeAes7Ny6RqzAW9XEvBnT5bquO9VHmBzSa9tQQzxRCA83p85lG8jBXT1E2N6r2NUPEgMMsOSoaEbuXZ2MAVmlF0RgePpAX8mDR45ijuyr8VDPDpr8tRDELdA_bZHVOTi3YmknRJkKUASMde9iVnsl8e72-Ajp_5445iWO8NI4N0ys6kHw==> . And read the earnings release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNzhVR_zWf9h3wEtQKy-HNiIs5N48Xrj0uK33jI-6ES9fNSH6-6dkHH_mwAoytDj3N1ptyWZ7ALpaotyxZSikrM_IbwuqUDTKZ99syPdHXd4eaYWUmNmjNhG41JfbP3eaDmOP5B12SAnTo641sn9Zp36ljSsB7RPnFSmZ5mz8Ap9ZgqGfeI7M5szUQZ7hhPPLkDRFkf3c9CmavyYu7T5e6K07COW2USg4MeQgfOnNHDEFA==> .


Big Shopping Data 


Ecommerce analytics startup Smarter Remarketer raised $7 million, according to VentureBeat. The small company, which was founded in 2010 by Howard Bates, has SkyMall, Eddie Bauer and Hugo Boss on its roster. "Our engine creates data sequestration profiles that enable customers to make extremely complex campaigns for retailers based on their customer's buying habits," Bates said. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001nXAszMwdsNwDnBYDreghLnMHpk8Te8agtalq9gIoega8IxtF7SJgasE9LNKBBFqLFYMsWcheVX2mazXcyB9NgK7_TQBjiQ-DXa1Aw1TimDw1PXskkADrHgICKXYkwFs0297Dt4-Kl1ccXCnsX6R0oBXnbbzqBlidcEbFTYRiuHmsZsxj9Ifr8PUpbgNk099g_j9iwLGs0mUNCX1DAvjqSrcEYGZ14wGoLxNf7TPUEyRY0TQd6-LX9ontPncg-hDs> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCkUHzS6CR8RNH2_5O2Hbx8X0evp3Tx-HE0ByG3msPfMye2CvSI9pJpHpTdfKy6xZL1FRmQGlLDY5d1yOMXtMOrRFpWTmUcCE2Siy4uAPYfYuCykungN00gG0KlivNBQ23k=> .

 

Twitter's Marketing Nest


Twitter is rolling all of its advertising products into one big bundle called the Twitter Marketing Platform Program. It will include all of Twitter's API, measurement and targeting partners. The blog post has some quotes from companies that have found success with the company, especially as it pertains to TV. Read the Twitter blog post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCkvE4UAfUoDZdIEREk1LXSa2wHY87WVwBsEcgK8JnBOcIoCEEcG-y3MbaDPpptgotGeSNsLSwE509PiS-OxtmG2sYhWAEUPl0Phz9f4dEQ59KmQ32aVl7MVfbyM6nJYyVBLVizg_S9mk1VL3MmnMu7Q1P1fAgfMg0loKfmvZDWeofLSmXRePo-Z> .


Time Targets Video


In the FT, Emily Steel says Time Inc. will launch a new digital sports network called 120 Sports. Steel explains, "The video and mobile-centric outlet will produce original sports programming in two minute-long segments. These will include game highlights, analysis and commentary from players and fans." Major League Baseball and the National Hockey League also have an interest. Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCnUkyyNMUiiadZ3Mb9mEzcf9bjYZPxLtVeJJ1eRcwpdm7JzgGhfjSwb2Is2KAiBjmGHtFSogNrRctWJirl7xbNxNcOkXBSSp2VCUIiE1OfGEQMFnYICA2Hykc80vDnQy71rq_XycsOFWoJFcT7rsh0rjHWtF5KOFsLi8TzoDc4e3nowtvgdRANJ> . From here, the clips will be ripe for short (10-15 second), addressable video ads.


Double Verifying


DoubleVerify said it has a new patent thanks to technology it started using in 2008. The release claims, "Dual-verification is the only methodology in market that enables a comprehensive and precise view of impression quality measures for both buyers and sellers by providing information on the page itself (actual landing page URL, length of pages, last modified date), how the ad was delivered to the page (ad server daisy chain, ad network associated with the page, cookie information on how the ad was served) and what happened when the ad was on that page (below the fold, competitive collision, frequency, multiple ads, missing geo targeting, ad clutter, some types of ad fraud, ad hijacking)." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCm-We-diBxmjE5z4F4C_yo44hPw7FJPgIkoCNQuLur1Ca9N35qEZAxozj65TpurbGGJEhHumk5M3d83EzJpRw2yL49ADkS_gv0vs9QqvrDNJ57xhyRYLUz1xVZx1tkqnu5252AtXdzDhyc0T_7ickR0> . Will this patent reopen the patent wars begun in 2012 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCmQweladq59NOL3sMiu0e6eYIyumeiNniynG7HqiffN6gWXW7DZ1ja2ccUQ9gSnyWlVKn4_66yRK4YmbE6Fd354TVzP6pneUTkr_iQiR5lJpCeymWeKSpC7tDO79e8q_vYI59ReXWwTaM8XzclL1JoXmTk_BcCK16--J_i7MYDOSw==>  with comScore?


Bidding Ad Networks


For advertisers using Rubicon Project's platform who want mobile RTB, a more robust solution has arrived in the form of a partnership with Dstillery (was "Media6Degrees"). From the release: "With Dstillery's self-serve platform Houston, Rubicon Project's ad network buyers can now fully activate mobile RTB capabilities[.]" More here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCkab5e3nJJ_BVA2B2MIHLA4I1I6lQnAm7CnP4xBz79j8IopABA6qJc0w51ygpa4jUy487bNbNGwqbbaKrlAGquxncqLaBR15AePo-tTmF71UoO4N0vYAlPMM5nY-K-chnxP8CakoidTum8_rCOIBcPUvzkNwybc_plIlTP5ZQoKWcltX6B75hPeK3si_FG-B1sGx8q153KJwWbKWMxLPCt1vF3T5ezI1_GCR3ktejLv6smc-BUiakz-BYL2NvrISZI=> .


Reviewing The Keep


Scott Kurnit envisioned a future in which people would want to save digital ads and go back to them later, so he started AdKeeper around that very idea. But it ultimately didn't work, says an article by Alex Kantrowitz in Ad Age. Kurnit believes people fundamentally don't like ads, so he's pivoted his company to be an ad-free Pinterest-like app simply called Keep. "I have advertising in my DNA and there has never been an ad on Keep," Kurnit said. "Advertising, more often that not, ruins content experiences." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksClonJSrbUR0vOPWsYQ34hgcKdCgVigSjwjBkZgqU-hEpL9clHdXnYqUn2Ae8WAIuQkuhNJw0vsI73b3c8BGOmXL313lJKtRbh1OlYOSpu7GeFnZX26_iyuEvUl0K8YoZOGLC1k-E5z13B1yyHpVq9ihceiQeAby2nYR_hSMaJtoE0QUZpe6OTVM> . And read AdExchanger's 2012 interview <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksClsa6fsSVHbG3W3dYOfB6LGrds_OOtIrcxk5P5RHFxn6nbBcPEW6lJJCQbgmoG1hjEdKH8-yzSYVB154_f1akHliAVPBDMEZfl1LnNqGG7S_uMj7sEjOfjTRzfeffsPpeR6lUTbuXRCl-nIrszL71GBAZ40Emol-hMOV_8YSCdv0g==> .

Better Targeting


Facebook continues adding targeting options to its advertising platform, with more complex geographical targeting, advanced demographics and more. The company outlined all of the changes on its news site <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCkri9f-0Zkmt5dZvXy6EmGo4W4PXnqHdU6rP2qcTFbs4m7aQ5rY05qwFav4XuG-iiUMYivzqMlsW6X8r2zUEYf9uNrJnN6aNzgMt7dR8cx9a-bimvmsylD2_6rmsMswJgUVcBo_10UImoNxm-XkjdFW> . AdParlor (owned by Adknowledge) CEO Hussein Fazal tells MediaPost's Mark Walsh of the changes that "rolling them out to the self-serve tool and globally should help the large SMB advertiser base." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCk4FJprFjyhKgv2_hnbia0sfk1zC0NK0ZEvyr81niwb6fIfooX3Qbrf47xW82r5NZJcpkxSfdlEfaUPdUima_hLy7yx_f7CJhcn6wnub3MVgnH1ZWoPePDy2SaqNqKCh3oEmosQ63YqECGd1DonZJ-h8KtrrnUJqjea1MUkPrpWfPAR2e7N_Q8DlHw8AZ1k2cLewv3IfVAjKcTArucpJHAP> .


Piracy Ads


Three-person Digital Citizens Alliance, which is run by <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksClYNBy0fBNevrEOpFT5sqBu_NbDK3Uphp9XV4x06eJ5o9qtpxP-9ZydiSOiZukISLw42yd0BAnf-J6QyX8aBJNIQ2e9WJz-Y0J-bfe3EB5rk_DfZKq8KJoMA6Igiw6zB10d7JZq6UwWwfMIy87thmncHJtp5NpQGnl1cHsyHN6wUAiHeXUnuh4eck1wuLYsNl0=>  former Verisign comms exec Tom Galvin, says that piracy sites it tracked made $227 million in ad revenue in the last calendar year. The Torrent Freak blog covers the news and says, "The major torrent sites have the highest profit margins and earn over $6 million each per year, partly funded by major brands such as Amazon, McDonalds and Xfinity." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0013ZozB6tksCkLWD_vkJuyEJ9OT1VzoXQiXaxfJGM1oU2-83VYk2m9JuIMoRNxyRs-wnFQMXphbQw1UsgaAVvx6sAQxIE1rgzbHwMml-zIKYAP4QA2UYXg3eHLVihSyPj3D2MZN6BVbC9XIPa9A6LVqB-GF7R-JlxR9JsNxQY_FAVWLJHoDHJylQ==> .

"In the past year, online video grew over 40% compared to a market that we believe has grown roughly 24%. When it comes to mobile, our business grew over 90% in 2013 and we expect to continue that trend..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	Amobee Unveils Mobile App Reporting And Analytics Tool, Monitors IDFA Developments <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5XXRxmiPyBlw3CzaDs8MplBu7X72fyqOY4XHipUQd-fB0mjyHC6tWMhJ68Pf1QCbEbhMAqOCPs1qLHwkafijRnGKJ2d2oPoRtcSOOURh-wgTuObj1wToM8an4iJRYybUnMaoE6vSTAgeLb3lL8xTkOEfaZDHa51Hoi3ldvXgs1j2Sa0Th3FwhfH6ZWrN3B82OCqp0wCH6Oxwy6KKTNXJV9kT_m4rtzfqJVpzpyzlYHG-Q==>  "We're watching the situation closely, but so far we don't see any traction to the notion that Apple will continue to reject applications that use the IDFA while not serving ads," Gil Sheinfeld, Amobee, said. "Since the news was first reported, we've seen apps pass through the App Store that do use the IDFA and don't show ads..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	Sprinklr Acquires Dachis Group, Preps Paid Social Product <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5Xfv9BEtNpGQRlGpjbKzoevpR_pTTsatzncmCLsyO0v50gvUoTtLoUemuoSjb-pREJUT33cJybNTJf8jwnt4ga4Rs5bDDYLx1wrnaTw02UoMle_afsfV8IC350NIfLXG8Nrx3UGAK585O1o6CquFmef5ERQcZPTYUZ0lJi2yz53ezn1Wim0UvmXohH3qIvhprOlvT_dVw3ODQXFokDqAZRJ>  "The beauty of paid integrated with social is you can amplify things that are working," Ragy Thomas, Sprinklr said. "There's all this talk about content marketing, but content is only one component of social marketing. There's data, context, connections, insights...and I think it will continue to evolve..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	The Cross-Device Question: Acxiom <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5VHY-gSXqG6QsEuUwhEfGpatfsuRct9snjjwJWh5yt8cdEA_jwG7vujChkyrvFXZBK9ts3dQ5JHkXUT6SiqTvWMLXSkpj6ULyOnekUfgR3rAjdPZfT6yzV4T4uqu4FlRNx-z2godMdHVzCZOHqDjbLiddQfkQSQS6cDDCKGojIgAWNL8lt0Du_b>  "To do stuff in today's world, I don't believe in the vision of a single monolithic database. Data is used at a single point in time and disappears depending on what permissions you have. It's about partnering and making real-time connections as opposed to owning every interaction..." (visit AdExchanger)

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5VbiGPGWsqikW5P8qsvB9G5CLKyS7KDHM6w-Xssyq_3-TLvVND8YS03oLTE7guIOZVtsDXTivjKTDH5WwhrjHsUM-_pnmgW7C6Jmwp4uHoAHYLOuXwg4Ii0bN1dbUPDfrk=> .

 

Do Not Track Mobile

 

In the world of smartphone tracking there are multiple ways for an advertiser to find a consumer. Privacy advocates in Washington are developing a solution that will allow consumers to completely opt out of all tracking methods by entering their MAC address into a database, according to The Wall Street Journal. So far 11 location analytics companies have agreed to participate. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5WKlDYNF7-vLKh_OR_FF-_1V5dgFYZS86TYyG9ZIfvjMosryHlIqje4JJhO2ujCJJiUW_TrxGbMPKcdSdbwCb_yJqBXigJCwEIWSdx2UmVGlcLx_NZMxLBMMExhwtg8S1Ycevpi4mTLfx7AQiTjgUsEGgoTmd3I20XnCjABN8JaozXNsxwTzye2SopK3A9wFUoV-3n07_vtfayO4UqolzFv> .

 

Fraud Council

 

In Australia, advertisers that operate programmatic platforms, including agencies and tech vendors, have united to create a click fraud council. One major issue that recently came up is the practice of dynamic masking, which allows a company to get around the blacklist temporarily, rendering brand safety tools ineffective. It's problems like these that the programmatic council hopes to stay ahead of in order to prevent future incidents. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5UocrvTMzK3ivdOsW0XIBcNF_rxdvjIYK3sehfy-9vcY2KZjDMvTetsVbiltY0y_TGaIWEXwP73pCA4F_dBG626LOjsEroBEQ53HFKHKW1LokybS4yIS66k0V1DeBdHe4taxLGrISK2uYD1crGOUivnY0leJ8VhoW2IICq_Zt2WiGViDhzOBhX_MYBxwvwjnhG-Q1Sv0k_DY-KKzj4z3m6VjT-5XGc91Rk=> .

 

Private Label

 

UK-based multiscreen ad platform Adbrain launched a mobile programmatic buying service in private beta, according to The Drum. M&C Saatchi Mobile, Annalect, Fetch and Somo will all participate in the private beta. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5X5G1VrcECL4VoZjgZA1xm4LBm6x8Y7XaOZYN_XfGtrCtPQUrlDN1xSWMmr676oN0CTKYIMaQPhE6DjwbK8K5nq7dIRekRzUJ_RFV0CuL04qqxGV0pL3-BqZ7jQIf0OwN4PeiMoxA4lBo-bVUoy--tjAZ7mBvffCo7EgSZ1GMnqjVmWWLSKAoYcnvUcWTNLgAQgmo5K9Ett47ZCysm8r6mYf0mHJT_Njxo=> .

 

Zipping Message

 

Rance Crain, Crain Communications' president and the editor-in-chief at Ad Age, explores data and privacy in an op-ed for the trade publication. Crain observes, "Programmatic buying through a myriad of ad exchanges is zipping messages to the farthest reaches of cyberspace, and there are so many missives going to so many places that nobody is really sure of what's being conveyed to whom. Even the digital-ad media say they can't always keep track." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5Wpu9nuYT6Th3iIyd4vvQ95w0Cwep6XlJ42g9f5s_Lf8I_vAyDzE_RXm980Qr6pWHj5BjqLP2mtV-nISenzrxAj4TgnBtUF3sFmMZSrVaL4SlxAyiKjvp2N94-vKXU5oR287aUcSbahI_ZTNO35MFAKbmU3zqAfIalq3OKQWbSZvYYI7zQ9_Yzs36rWL8pmsZgTjzy2AS1Ib6692fj8FFc5> .

 

Premium Partnerships

 

MediaMath says it now has access to publisher platform Sonobi's inventory, which includes more than 500 publishers from the United States, Canada and Latin America. "We believe there is significant value compression across RTB spend," said Michael Connolly <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5VlFHVooaoj4CutoQz7Fzuks9Aw2ISxyAs3VA0qrjgRNfKX7bkTc6Vb3wJkjsI7F1zBM1-GIlGdpDx2n-UZZoMgyygA-2_8bdUtWyHbXj3Cmj2AUL3A-1rV09od5QhzqaVuDC-tzO7QABQ0HKU5WCsDeS13ZMPGz3g=> , CEO and founder of Sonobi. "When a publisher is able to identify and isolate high-value users in a premium auction, it increases organic demand that does not exist in the RTB market today." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5VeSXhqi3VIYNgbJUlYjlaheeyHZJrJyF5JqvOv9_XXmZ-xwxB2b_gE8j2EghB9L4AapAq2AzJs591VDL03-uifzvkgaKuYsPoKVxNA3_wykZUHGFyywSkI4IX0y-pIRmgmnlNeUnq3h_KEt4GCBjZY-O--0MDj7IKPLy1WWXH4ZbjO-zeTTTg0I7clktQnQ17lS7mq4vIJufAnYXh6BjGcKQV3iAPOo3AYOchvHlHzgKcAlV8wG-UGwAp4Ais8e3o=> . Chris Karl, a former MediaMath SVP, recently joined Sonobi as its chief strategy officer (a.k.a. chief revenue officer).

Open Internet Battle


The FCC isn't giving up on Net neutrality, but it has been forced to pivot, according to GigaOM's Jeff John Roberts, who reviews a commission statement on the matter. Roberts writes, "Now, owing to its bungling of the earlier process, the [FCC] is now tasked with putting the net neutrality genie back in the bottle. [FCC Chairman Tom Wheeler] signaled his intent to do so at several parts of the statement <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5U6ca4xocK3M2OvNZGSX9Q4YbT3p8y_3DIQy3XBFut3htCnE9cDoDSvmxKsyT1MNVGwl2kvFDjWWqICe2W_Rxr0ZqxZuU5iGp9_nPDZIvyqbKiWZhbZFI_c-vyNJ_A62MUrhq0ucjzwMgsvqhizxJ-dGmcmIhViMZgroCoUfnVBtxCMY69uUY2msjyKFh397t4=> : 'I intend to accept that invitation by proposing rules that will meet the court's test for preventing improper blocking of and discrimination among Internet traffic [...].'" The National Cable and Telecommunications Association appeared pleased and said in its statement: "We continue to believe that the values of an open Internet can be preserved, while avoiding a damaging move to heavier regulation." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5Wq24x80-vjSMUtqk2fVBwBBliJIo3VIW6tCdj4r2oQ158H2d0VFxrSM2kKlhb0oLBcmCWf_vw9GJSpZG8F3ynZL9oqSOk4lYaibYaN85yx5hdf4Jg2HGDFIVITup0bwIDNB33KngJ2dqFaGn40Nm_IF6lraa8CtZ04ZO7wZz5iKaQz0OU92kPPBh0Cs6RBLbndgxkswJl-FjYm3Ms5q6ROSKuZV34Erlm-x8PyRA_LCp0o0cYQl_k-> . The White House hasn't given up, says The New York Times <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5Xug5PaBF4wj7QrXFx6zR1T5jhrotSFX8D5O-SMVDDKd2b1-XHq__RisztKEBLUgn0eOxTZrrfOa8bSdmQw6A68qEkRJ_gEXUN6zbHQPVPNq7-maED_BOb7uRXSAj5dDGpkJ7rB7w_mVjtt9Z8Z2EWO35DUDI8OXoVkiW65egL2fOL7QBTExlP2iDBuMeQsjl-TC_WFRt5SZg==> .


Native Gemini


Following Marissa Mayer's statement last week that Yahoo is "long on search," the company rolled out a new platform on Wednesday, Yahoo Gemini, and described it as "the first unified marketplace for mobile search and native advertising" in a Tumblr post. "With Yahoo Gemini, advertisers get the performance and ease of search, combined with the scale and creativity of native advertising," writes Yahoo's Jay Rossiter, SVP of its cloud platform group, and Adam Cahan, SVP of mobile and emerging products. Advertisers can access Yahoo Gemini via the company's self-service buying platform, Yahoo Ad Manager. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001hKm-rkS1Z5WZLfdqbYxriryccDpFrXOsmfgEViD34aiAqHAXXmrOZFDOQEs9hiwz97TL6dy0xDp5uHsUUG3weBvW31F9XOkMKcUkS99JbyGovdj0gkBN8EPBKB14MkyHu9yY_SseI0asuouaKYfNdhOcaSGUu026jq-TBYv4vjIyx_LIQ4EaAw==>

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?

Ads, Apple And Amazon


In Ad Age, Kate Kaye looks at how Amazon and Apple are faring with Madison Avenue when it comes to advertising sales. Kaye finds challenges and writes, "Apple's and Amazon's arrogance in mobile and e-commerce, respectively, is earned. But neither has developed a strong b-to-b sales or service culture. Another media-agency exec contrasted Amazon's style during quarterly sales meetings with the more energetic pitches from Twitter and Facebook." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKjIctkm80W4sxtDlQmSw4P5lewG2YU8d4VN2Nd7qUj1FAPCWonEpz2EYIJa3DwZ3uZ3qS7hBfGr_-XP9NJ_gyyrEVuTgZd1wKa2jkujqGbYkz7TNX4MECCSDvpDM_VQu5_7-DyefKQY_lEdHZ1Y9Xrh-50zECvVyaNMTbkhvwNrh24NOHqIOVdQK00cRdvKl0E=> .


Light Up The Data


A new wave of LED lighting systems in airports and other public locations are doubling as camera networks. The New York Times notes such lighting "pipes" can support data collection - in both good and bad ways. "The system could, once software is developed ... make shopping more convenient - a potential boon for malls losing business to the Internet. Sensing a shopper pulling into a parking lot, the system could send an alert to a smartphone, showing empty spaces, or a coupon." Says Sensity's CEO, "We see outdoor lighting as the perfect infrastructure to build a brand new network." Privacy concerns abound, of course. More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKiniDvW_LEhTVPDUdg2QwKAJ7xz6mBFc2cWtqxHoJglojkTtUTpyHrbgxh_sYbaLqgYAB38zI_nTGMQ5BLzJdOSRTX0masPm7dAeqSyPDMjyCnodqbl33X6-zWghg8-yFsPshTDtXEaBWAqbp_FqH1cxWUYYdOyo1EIZfKYU7QxbbogjfWcFfLmt_sNNzO_75O8Jze67EKtc-kAFVuyER4PPKXNhTALrEiuWyFZgaddY15N-oUFBNqZDCcqmwIUU0Fd2wm-PPcZV5CPJ47V7V90> 


SaaS Ads


Formvertise. The name says it all. PandoDaily's James Robinson delivers a feature on the startup, Formvertise, and reports, "A $2,500 annual commitment to a campaign reportedly guarantees a brand 750 sign ups. For $5,000 they get 150-300 new customers. At $20,000, a customer can set their own demands. It's advertising done on a 'software as a service' pricing model..." Read more about the form ads <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKgSzkNwx9G66lTdG5Gx8PIs6VUBSHwEAPPkwhqDNOgo4npdn-V36t6SUwIiY50QQ1s7fAGH8okZzr5yYjxafdJ0ZIBYOF69qYIQfFs7PlIA9VNM39jXlSh3qMHD0jRQkVUcoOHf965D1U_gJviLpf5pacTESFkFII_EZHWboZecCPh64UrIV2wBSbr45qkpGNMNPRll5LowKvF7JUFqhO4V> .


The Native Question


Native advertising is lauded by some and despised by others, and the question of where it's heading is still up in the air. Ryan Skinner, an analyst at Forrester, explored this discrepancy and concluded that a lot of it centers around the ambiguity of the term "native." The main factor that may ultimately decide the fate of native advertising is user response, but there is no clear data on consumer perception just yet. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKj7kwaMw3MoYQFwaMnxqZFAGz4TtaYGBE5gDMJv-IAwUpPDpnCA1Db6cDFYPs9hlHAyi_P3x5Y6BNwT_xE8YL2m3Ko5AU1Z7EXK2ijfF4l0UnSxF31AnIHVd921F9HLzTqm6g3sVbRM144I_UCLCnnMN3JROICnDTzQ_36tImV-BiIEJ-yN5AKWveo2eFTYhV6OMI0Ze2YRLGYctq0GBb_N> .

 

Going All In


Although some publisher networks have taken the plunge to being exclusively programmatic, Mike Kisseberth, CRO at TechMedia Network, warns that this approach will not work for all publishers. In a column for Folio, Kisseberth notes that publishers that offer customized or native placements will not be able to go fully programmatic, but that doesn't mean they can't mix it in as part of the larger strategy. He writes, "The technological infrastructure simply isn't there to leverage programmatic for high-engagement custom or native programs, so it will be some time, if ever, until we see publishers that offer this deeper mix of inventory going all-programmatic." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKhMJUMrCbnQUrFRk5ovpAwzsWmVJx4TypvnioU-B_qw0jh1AtFdzHerL71y3ptMB-PfegrJNB34i9pOfiD_3TAtnvE0ps7JeDQzHaWaUvJ_3-DxNHyWch9biE_5U_JunKZlxIw8l-zeiHGUDYg0q67iZ8M24WoBqHzUnz2QUbElNNeBNJW8av7bJbeZ_nLbysI=> .

The Next Programmatic Wave


Although RTB led the programmatic wave, there has been a shift in perception that has advertisers thinking of different ways to use programmatic tech, according to Tim Cadogan, CEO of OpenX. In a column for MediaPost, Skip Brand, CEO of Martini Media, relays Cadogan's thoughts about programmatic and where it's going in the future. According to Cadogan, advertisers are entering a phase of programmatic sophistication. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKioEcj5dRVPK9WKSL5p8Je-WPGXE1nhnNubYNM87n1C5dR8zYR0IOOlnl8CVb8mexooGzOtbCe6ojyjFMV7UiO1eIZ30jMuj-qs9-vXoUeqdn08vsQPQjr9h-oRh1aDEY0G8PVrbTDujh66QI8zCi_pf4dVfJgIrtKFfu6QWejbjBrDpIEoG7f3m8SJAcTtL2wXEjr32T3kLb2_CKe8eC4spCxe2gBVe4Q=> .


Piracy Battles


A new report from the Digital Citizens Alliance found that piracy sites brought in around $227 million in ad revenue in 2013. There is pressure mounting from multiple sources to stop advertisers from supporting these sites, even if they are doing it unwittingly. "These premium ads are on sites that are stealing content, which gives the content the incentive to keep going, and at [the] same time, it damages the credibility of the brands," Tom Galvin, executive director of the alliance, told Adweek. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001mu4VfeL3BKgg57NoSUMY9yS19Mgl6O4ZwPrjcgdiKpS_5cwYa60FEkTeAFKluo84NQZvK5ESDfu2KB8iVAOF19btKj8WfKd6q6cqPeB414i6CjlTaSjSMJVgp46QGZ_j3DULALaZop5EbiQEzLVRcULIN48bBWW13OOaKWX228L9skUjM7TguuwJrQH5cbXaP9LLFqIAupPT64sgIOMHGeFtbIYh2z2kSYLJR7kPQ9Yc7zIpsh6qTw==> .

*	Apple's IDFA Crackdown Reverberates Through Mobile Ad Ecosystem <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2fqOzp6xRkseuxK3sxmMoXOW2fYCJMTBtZiJ6LTn66dvp7oJgwuvkMSQbquFp2_AyOrEMIBjH8eeM1rwm8PPToDshG0UaV10Fs4bNbAkECB9zhg6wLwc1hsGrz_RKC4y6r-AB1cJM8GqYDe89IOo6sIgmj1vpoJeIq61U2sjdIwavOy35O8Wni2waAMF2pgurfDUAuehOuYt17qdIOimKj5>  "The IDFA does not provide a holistic solution. She agreed with McCall, however, that advertisers need alternatives to IDFA: "This is also a reminder that we as an industry cannot be dependent on a single data source, since you don't know where the fallout will be..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	Behind eBay's Ads Business: We Think Our User Data Is 'Pretty Important' <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2erV0MPHd5s4qv74H22zYEcj7Lc5HX5LrsH_MDnkA2LbqMvcbewmMeSppZhTQvNTc2w9aYltOYxg4Co5v7pXZuxFCG9Cj1iHTz_7g5_wpofvS5otGb64brwlQB4nl02RYmbVA5-RhLX-mM51AgZu7_-7n9fwsL8c6XZMkImpktNgL6-rMnczvgrc4EQbbjmam0NxFcZX5fzSkf3rh8TTdnp8C-kIaAgb4GRoq9jkUI9yA==>  "One area we have a bit of a gap in is video. And this is something we see across the Triad portfolio [of ecommerce sites]. There is a lot of money flowing into that [area] largely in the pre-roll business, so we're actually looking at the eBay Audience Platform and being able to access pre-roll video and then we have the eBay data behind that with a premium built in..." (visit AdExchanger)
*	The Cross-Device Question: BlueKai <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2f4WX8oD6cJm-ZI9Ixz4ZbMORqQBt0saW6iZ4U87o5rm-qnaNU8-rxKgDdPIiucAxVT9HgpQWDeAZpM3abvCgQwmPxEjmhbLGWHN2njWJhz5khLp0vSIRL3v71VU3qqu_GZR5SzXqU9Gn114QkYoSsbJSUaG41nwc1pR3IB3zKxQ4u6rn1bfN8A>  "First thing we're starting to see is offline to online linkages. That comes through various providers and that's pretty standard. The linkage that's more interesting right now is online to mobile. Now you've got a ring of three channels that are connected..." Yahoo And Contextual


Re/code's Kara Swisher says she has the inside scoop on CEO Marissa Mayer's plans for Yahoo, which Swisher intimates may not include Right Media Exchange. Instead, among other initiatives, Mayer may pursue something called contextual search. Swisher explains what that means: "Unlike keywords, which are inputted by a user, contextual search uses all kinds of signals that they share, most times without an effort, as they move through the world, both digitally and physically. This is the red-hot opportunity of mobile, because consumers are constantly beaming information from devices that can be taken advantage of by Yahoo and extended to marketers." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2fvTxLSs7JkAJ7scpHLFYREX31cfO5umka3XZs6hUnm3RFo_n3D7G5j-p9BWE9OLLWjRDImss_FrV3hMWV1mOqKW_IwCP1Wj2S06IA1buyWaPBiD1IvF6D9Uf8uff4ZXoMO896wsKKTABi1nkrriGjU8L4y5RThyOYJrJ5wW-gnEBE6SqCIEBHgM5YFfcONOFRcOYSBydIr6hO7P1WhJynHWq9-JFZJIY4NwJ3wa6w4bA==> .


Connecting The Consumer


During a cable industry conference keynote, Forrester analyst James McQuivey may have put the fear of world media domination into attendees. Multichannel News' Jeff Baumgartner reports, "Although many worry that Amazon, Sony, or Google and its YouTube unit will go over-the-top with a virtual pay-TV service that competes directly with cable operators, McQuivey said that these digital platforms are really looking at TV as a way to maintain and grow their connection with the consumer, and to get them further hooked into their respective platforms." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2cIPrZ7PixYAWPcsYAIaSkj5KhyTX3VQiz1oRd-qdj7aES39LLvGdIo0A3Ais0iEUnI3hlPVMTZkAbzO5P3TH1HhVhjwBHPgXFNae9xPCLHvZXj6znTD266A7EmHmu4qHfwFU6MVvY6Tpr05eN77I8VdnhqAZVCfCNpCMPOEwBA7bf_9Q-mVJG4CDA_zvEduhY=> .


Organizing YouTube


A new trade organization has emerged for YouTube video creators called GOVA (Global Online Video Association). Paul Kontonis will lead as GOVA's executive director, according to Adweek, to help organize the industry and attract ad dollars. "All these companies were formerly defined by just having a bunch of channels on YouTube, and it was about aggregating views and prerolls," Kontonis said. "Now, they've all become major digital media companies. They all have interest in bringing dollars and attention to the space. And they need a group like GOVA to protect their interests." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2fg9-cAeAh87OD7ehZ43SIU1W2jy8K_3ioJPJSvsP2lXe6f1uUwVBj1lbF4vcAcFns6y4SsbwYYNYUinfjN-7kMDSHcmQxG0J3P5J-NSQp81OhZL6F1h3u6Kv72XrQY7TeZSSX1JEF8NyyUnsr9YWQ42s5L-hyfkTIk4TnEshldvtXtBA0hPAv1l9Eu0nuXdM0OHBNSbiRLcQ==> .


Location Always On


Before iOS 7 an iPhone app was able to access location data without having to be running, and it seems Apple will be bringing that feature back with iOS 7.1. "[T]he forthcoming iOS 7.1 will allow apps to access users' smartphone locations even when apps are turned off from running in the background," writes Digiday's John McDermott. The solution will be useful for advertisers that rely on accessing location information without having the consumer explicitly using an app, but the user has the chance to opt in to which apps can tap into location data. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2czbvmWx5EBZTkIOH4qMO5EyMIgCJTrrNEqXmUM4G8CDyG_DlyKdzjinFJ8mM5Be4FbYFkUXVHBsewi2OfHNL9guK28lT8g3omUFRrIfyHuHnMT9SwyBlETL_6PKumB8sMFE5z-xMxje1rUg8f28WdC> .


How Mobile Is Mobile?


On Marketing Land <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2cVmUI0TvLY6RarvDZyhHWKIhgQsZBVwxwCIcHymEGuABjEJyUw0gsUMYr3cC3qkDAEBkfKVv8XGHcv6jS0ARWiWC1BwQ1qNZP_Y41DQQC-HYeULk77osCYMWAQ-Dw5aIb_-GCRwgpCc3ER_RMcoKiviiNERnZehh0uf789u_DQicTyDSM0IvPISW-waOB_IU2RvGuasVL2ZQ==> , analyst Greg Sterling takes a look at a new study from Pew Research that shows several interesting data details as it relates to Internet and mobile penetration, including: "China is the world's largest Internet and mobile market. Yet 63 percent of mobile users today don't have smartphones." Get the Pew Research press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2dvrv22-eV0Ft27qNiBarAC68s4ujESE1er6u3jjw6Ha5gmJj2Vihozbg6DUH_XwCKGLt6cQGigwnv0CN79pLEkANcjNxQKYSeZqqqfd2LFVjwQCsBEUUnB5qV77aI5UemsG9ss-CVcerxwO3pAHsKcEpjHPM5Bz5WPmQIjhILl2_b9X5W2QtpqwNWuGAcwr3leEQBvlBqe3g==> . Also, Inside Facebook looks at the international mobile market here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2ca3sLtt6wGAfN8_x4kXmSdHglBTK9IuJsuG9qOsMzLFbxamTCf6M2kG2oHSAzM05BfSHBjadZWcGSeg1z8FBlJsDkUrx7KymgL-zBduGqiWgmvp5jLuXUQeyhQ27YKwSH1ybeUH2o0ujxozods2QLxqpXdcpO4y8u3dKpk2PgCooEickDFKzfv9nkE3q8K1x1UHItze9UE_Q==> .

Social DOOH


PepsiCo is marrying user-generated content to digital out-of-home advertising, according to The Drum. Called the "Unbelievable" campaign, the company will comb Vine for videos submitted with the hashtag #LiveForNow and select the best to use for its campaign. "Social video and digital out-of-home have interesting similarities and short-form, entertaining Vine content is perfectly suited to the DOOH channel," said Rich Simkins, innovations director of Talon Outdoor. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SuL2P0RlX2cm3qhLWvljCbp53nvB042fjnMaerUe1qaApS29laCmQK4syuApl_4iDimyQdndDadEqYPqgcUvf5JDY-9TX1nr3xLZ-g0SGS5pIjnzUuEXWWGJC7TAb6BZMz5pbOm98kKZRqqcWlF6UC05GFRWJxdxC_7A8N1Oy5w21MYhgEe6WCY1lg_zBmIRQ66pav9VcHmCP76-8rp-LSUcREPLO8kL> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcJCp0z9PMMikT8SS4DSeuhEbOQ5N2VmuvSJ44XXuEAvtauGyTLyHSJNqTgjbPjIStgxoSqRASIPJXr9TwFjiuZg8K-pZOe5fXYh-mjXSW-0uBSeuCp55DqiRqn24_aPTno=> .

 

Let Them Buy Video

 

Microsoft has provided a "cross-screen" video upfront deal, of sorts, to Starcom MediaVest Group and its clients. According to a release, the deal provides "access across the video opportunities afforded by Microsoft properties such as Xbox, Skype and Ads in Apps on Windows 8, as well as MSN and the Microsoft Video Ad Network[.]" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcIx-8FARkrm9vjOscmgQbkxG1vNG6CoeZBzBTQ_FAc192OLThazsajcQMcSTnRwnlCk3pgmytyXmGC2UvzKgGaX4q0eFIYX8SGmOl0xKI4BnwBJf8drvOWGwsCRHB-kTU8PCP9PczirVn2VpaRwuH77jyKhWdo4KyRenDDiB78_yTWHRv6Y3G61MMWMq3_IKQRt8gTzF-XWWn0HN8B0SZe_fOgNCdkHFvOJ3gNTdGlG1mRX55JdoKJ0EGziIXmfv3s=> . Ad Age sees it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcJxX4E28wpn8gfKKsNzK6Z8BZCirHXJ9qgHn6KOYtUHZzZy72nahJMcGVq3GmrKjwA9m67JhWXIP5e7Ci8FErHXOIjUAxrkte2XnWeThm9H50WTPKs8Ec4BcSnvZfcaXkUbI-7oP9EZRlCG7UzBixLREqS5VKBEx5r7vbKwPvVcT-5BYYAJVwlbgp8fSUw8zdeuxpMJCwCSzA==>  as a try by SMG to secure Microsoft ad budget before it loses the business to another agency.

 

Second Chances

 

As AdExchanger first reported, Facebook kicked out <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcJVVzx-WH8kz4frG8X2vyZMGhvLx1VHsH2aqk36a2y-V5_YCkCX11cmms0-DUKSVYhbuShtngHx1k442mAoD4Zk6twrN84duM5CBUPnwX-AQDLY6XzR73ZxccwJGmVAnaBpafI-GECSwqcfcy8ZZIpOD8LHHEOYfhBfo8fxsb-hokZdwGdtvMHNB3C8HBAT45nEz8zcBExFIf9oRBLK_Pn_iAIElabcCSU=>  HasOffers and Kontagent from its mobile measurement program, but HasOffers is asking for a second chance. "Facebook has done some amazing things in in the market in terms of expanding the mobile advertising ecosystem," HasOffers CEO Peter Hamilton told VentureBeat <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcJJYwBeVapV3Gwwy1vSlkebUfJDR1wwdKrJlw3pSenmkDYlszTLmsJohZgM0YYodYfj8XbDUHg1ncy3CDLClTkGysk9JhbgADTrIMYZBk8XKGN8WwkiWQHJ8_HcGflkmd6Tgfi7_FiLTDlJmOanpq_jfkODMc4JpxEeorGpHrR_dQsB2AsdqJLsj_sZGMddaRELF7GQcJakYtIoL0Fa4mmL> . "I don't want to be pointing the fingers at anybody, but we deserve a second chance." The company was given the boot after an audit indicated that it didn't adhere to Facebook's data policy.

 

DSP Checks

 

Liz Rutgersson of UK-based agency Periscopix takes readers through her checklist when choosing a demand-side platform (DSP) partner on Search Engine Land. She writes, "Many demand-side platforms will emphasise the reach of their inventory as their key unique selling point. In practice, I've found that of the biggest DSPs the difference in reach is minimal." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcKCQW9YPW3LiJ94ZNuMtqLSuj-tlUdjggZWn6Aoc2-Xp9fDfhTTB3r6ep6Xidj46ArGxr8tIL39X8kswivI1XOiF7BybXSeB9gzll46Qzr-COnXEfYyZOzm72PBJXoS07-BCwQShSTYkYhu7mCWdvKnad3VT24gOcJtF3vV2lminJA64j5ApeqOu70rpcgfcGQOq4_WDzBhouNevYM8eAN92wmBNap6rj8=> .

 

Native Nose

 

On PandoDaily, staffer James Robinson takes big traditional Web publishers to task for a lack of acceptance of native ads. "Whether it's native advertising, well-done product placements, or Pandora targeting ads to listeners based on political persuasions, online advertising is now the dominant advertising market and it is evolving rapidly. By holding their collective noses, traditional media companies risk getting even further behind," says Robinson. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcI03pd2ZjYgaGwku2cZOYU4yrH6dB3oOjS2_lSyPv_zOGhsRt-c75L64zVBE1ES-wfTnn7z7LRFr4Mcc1NCHVWhU0b2Xk89YbUxgoyg-YarxpfNMSDMTIyiyaU3AQepC3ffAtaf8v10VqduAOo8o36vKEVvVlnbRDMuSgsLyOSPPprykAKonKxldwzrrRIznsTsZcz4shJnx_OKE6xnEyrd> .

 

Brazil Digital

 

Emarketer taps a study by WPP's IPOPE research firm and augments with its own calculations in a look at the Brazilian media market. A familiar refrain ensues: "In third (with pay TV included in the overall television total) came Brazil's rapidly expanding internet market, which generated $3.4 billion in advertising spending in 2013, up 11.8% from $3.0 billion in 2012 - pushing investments in internet ads past magazine ads, which actually dropped 4.2%." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001SXcCQuombcIW3YyEU9FM68j7AAQlnRnL3uc_G46pI2ngTj4b-u6brSE3T3glK8FGj53WeAT4eA_zglyZvJx0Vg69IbyHRfcjG7lOkuhpwjJkVWYzGgZUBeiYLY8H0OcI1RUA9NSxZS_8zovXGhJKpihUt4eu8fZkoFRXjXPc52z2GQM0rBCywOSBntlVpziWFKL4MWfOaZjvuC3BgE-0TQ==> .

Ned Brody Speaks On Yahoo


Ad Age's Tim Peterson gets Yahoo's Ned Brody to talk ads in a Q&A on Ad Age. About the ups and downs of display results at his company, he says, "I believe a third of the company is new, over the last 12 months in terms of people. You've seen the launches of all these things from the weather app to the food and tech channels to stream ads. All of those are brand-new products. And they've actually resulted in the metrics for Yahoo going way up." Read more on Ad Age <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019mKu-BfPL-76lCc3KhglfbCLHg1vG7v9GDcWEsF2hUfD611A-ulMZ6hivGMkF3C96GAPVCCpELk2s5tzOzX0kWCfrkBVfLOw1TSms5fClixcSSEoLBl7p1Z6V4pMHaE4XjMltUjVtyI5mO5gXcrtv9PXUCvBC-CgkZmHH8Nf9NWQYB8duNvxLV0pu1LLfNatzB7Zc-ezrtTXJ5biXCgAxTfJ3u33O1Xh> . Brody also hopes to monetize video in a bigger way as the company gathers more users.


The Ratings Battle


Nielsen is facing some stiff competition from other ratings services, especially comScore, now that advertisers are looking at performance both on TV and digitally. Then there's Rentrak, which is doling out TV ratings from set-top boxes. With shifting viewer habits comes a need for networks to accurately measure the full, albeit fragmented, audience in order to get the most ad dollars. "We welcome competition if someone wants to come and challenge us on these things," Megan Clarken, Nielsen's EVP of global product leadership, told The Wall Street Journal. Read on (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019mKu-BfPL-7t5NsZBGksf25hAsK4QmgwbsMB_DEnO3t75YqzspZXSymtT5Bqm37qG9JmyX6zrnkl5wPVJOqwK4JfomjE3TwDBthlEjkQLp1G7nxmMahcJV1r_QIxXUCCo-ysWCrfVr61m2t9kLQpilNrlKdmrCf2v3pvZoaZaDuAIBYlcM2pzL8SsZYKHF5uKWxTObq8-lc=> .


Ad Tech Portfolio


In her post on Medium, Nexage's Jayne Pimentel talks about technology: "How many of us have all three of these: MacBook Air, iPad, and iPhone? We practice portfolio management to mitigate risk in other facets of our lives and businesses, but when it comes to technology and devices we do the opposite thanks to the ease of use and user experience of having one operating system, one platform, one experience. So why are we so nervous to use this for adtech(?)" Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019mKu-BfPL-4AsRXH4tMcvCFafe5gbP3U2gSQYEhx6SF3rnrwW07YHFnxwnBs1XT5dClp648hOxK2IUeKan5y3aRsf7m9kxdjbR8pxd8cxa5JFL1NBG8tbtPg29XdqbsAynJQe9e9bU6NyygVz1rq1LSCi4P3-OV-QJV9qC6z--LBrCzdUOTKng==> .


Marketing Automation Takes Hold


New research from Frost & Sullivan delves into the growing marketing automation industry, and finds that it is fast becoming a necessary tool for digital advertising. More than 80% of marketing automation usage is concentrated in the US, and the three largest players - Marketo, Eloqua and Silverpop - dominate almost half of the industry. "Establishing a repository of successful case studies with vertical specific use cases will help vendors accelerate the deployment of MAS globally," advised Frost & Sullivan digital media industry analyst Hiral Jasani. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019mKu-BfPL-6HvUhgyYfHFty18K88dnm0lBdYqPmoVoswsllTX1iR9I3bxs34r0VQXM8clYh2uTSx5yPRXuUPR5C8f6RVwxzrF4_5yG9Wv_mqwpBeVfZA1oi6Pdpfwyvdb7m3U1GZu51fyD8fPevPjO5y-KWuA-7ZtnvR1gDU43iHBRS1wkB1pn2kq-vywd6UnBUcf8KQOVWCi4QA9h2zMvZSpwolc-Mb_ZsOqNQjwNdQMfMoPLwR7Y6KM3MFjR5v6K5qZ1tpTttHrULopVERjA_38ewOL-YBQOE9TLlb67mPtK0xfkBYdg==> .


Millions And Millions


Mobile ad network InMobi reaches 759 million monthly active users, at least that's what it told TechCircle, putting it second behind Facebook for mobile reach. The company says the majority of its reach is to users in the US, with China and India coming in at second and third. The company also says it has been experimenting with different formats including native and interactive ads - presumably beyond your standard mobile display ad. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0019mKu-BfPL-4fb-Z8LgnqZizytcQAwMDxRlAedbt8olYw54lPDW3wUibn8K-4UhYKeVkIqJbYIjxCIQQtiYW__Bk-G1Gp50SON5dFzCa-7FrAkJ31j9oevGiTwpnZ-IvM1c0ZkZlMgeG7xJPQN-xcLiTc8f2Y7lFA7tmrJg7L7CDqXnQCo94KTum7uKz5Ooqgeohckrrd3wV5bKqwkfBc8x_b2shrLATMgZjkdu7Qx3DLAJSfG_6dBQ==> .

Native Exchanges


Native advertising appears to be a success, but making it scale is a problem some companies are now trying to solve. Native advertising exchanges are popping up and the last one, as AdWeek's Mike Shields reported, is Bidtellect <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_JhjDW5bGVNhXJOtgUBxf6ddmT19_2fPMNNGbTdag0RX7AT-6g1mcPFebg0Tbf2TVKV3S8EZNNTTCnBRIiWrkvyGB45f8w8C-kmMRfs36zNjw==> . The company is run by John Ferber, who founded Advertising.com, and Lon Otremba, who is CEO. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_LC6y5tQLWneGqLzPndGcWh-7trdbuhejFcXkzzPsCiX0OKxIkRmSY6nro15kgevetF-3PKB5hVYeDSEQPxBFC2nHSs0h51YvHRb07ixl6bebrif2dQBlJCzfnaj8SBCoJOI5wMDD6z9aNRo81Mj9kLQPqwdvh28fZNHxJb6S8vWeHduHfudUR8IloX4hwCHHu5v2dlQ9TxUQ==> .


Augmenting The Exchange


Former AdECN ad exchange (acquired by Microsoft in 2007 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_Ids1e4HibpNYbCZhudX1RwXbHccCnBV16rzAnWuz2Wdf2fDO7ZvKU4NXBSJE53-WIpZaY-MOLISnyiPF4G_r8dqD5NJBhfFPNc22q-G_Fa0JjiF1ugK3jCVbwFWXRvIrZMlSuR4i1fVZnb_3pPozVQ4LlqDbhNJ5K4SGBFvTOUxw==> ) CEO Bill Urschel announced on Tuesday that his new company, A6 Corporation, had acquired "ReachLogic Media, a programmatic trading desk based in New York City." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_Jt3tmS5Sg5Y2klI5j2iLUDE3GSxSKd0tkM2A3YMVXBdFa3vKa9mM2YOo6zd7Zsb_JJqIjl4seoNJRYcb_-AkNOW2Z4B2cD06mCVwoOeim37xhSmXi1lDbD28Nob3w_6A2GbJ4QFYADWV1At6XWkFfpHN8x2zed6LvDhPcyTkFtarVloQiZVn1ek0k0aLjunE0=> . And read GeekWire <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_LH8unsZ5xy2XZ_Q9gVhB7-WIsS5pOy4hHjw8JUpAVjQ97rMbujLc0ZX3MkVestk1-wyu4M07LqwSa6pne4GOTwZ88MGgyXnZqShotXDv0IqDdGBefb_ovXgTQM_2W8M-M_ztMn2a782j0yKzZYvWG21Grdl5V_OIJKVVZW1-PQsZxNIkRW9I6V> . The ReachLogic team includes former AppNexus team members who have already been listed in sales and biz dev capacities on A6's "About Us <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_LEUvI7Tot-jPwxk0B0k3vFz-SYd341hB6ixHm4VoUqw3MYHmzZ3850kpGoHeq8_hIz-8AV4BpqSq4XSIZgW_f6I1TDLyrz0YG1XUhmwx13aYyRfAEbiJJv> ." Part of A6's pitch, according its website: "Running your own campaigns on AppNexus? Use our data for better performance." See it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KAz9tlMvC1Fj5uzQyyYnBVG1Xr38hJ3380zTi1-afgfa18b7-RVods70pTM89RgdK2iFKjgexJbFEvb7uRAx9s5k05F1BnU1zymY4FnTPGsA-RFqrVDPRa> .


More On Fraud


At the IAB's Annual Leadership Meeting, Ad Age caught up with Michael Tiffany, who fought against cybercrime in the financial industry, and who is now an anti-fraud advocate for advertising. He started a company called White Ops to help detect and eliminate bot-infected ad campaigns. In a video interview, Tiffany acknowledges that problem can affect any type of company, including premium publishers. Watch here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_J26JP7MROqUAm99-ElP2Y20m4K6nZ_thbHgSCQPqInw8DarOS5m0vX-1yhXkPXrbKkSwjAbs_83CiYnnht5p1x8V1z3S-TchS7H69jT1ijNcR-AP-tpjwEC1-Aa-jTcak5NjLDEgqXeMZrt0X8Y1tmRQmhIFfXqGKEuMjF97Jrig5ZeB8-1VXvhWAounEBUUYwwEyffgSCaohGkD2KOUC3Q7pzBs7uGrIuvOeqeT-_jA==> .


Alibaba USA


Alibaba is coming to the US in the form of retail site 11 Main <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KGMwOmrn7clGk4mkTUz_SsXQu2urWL_5Vvlju_EbfuBYL748L9LmCgmiDFyh9JCFJMNK3WURoW2kAif8jXQul2MgSVNdP4rBXqKpvVvX_aKQaj5LygW17T> , according to Reuters, via its subsidiaries Vendio and Auctiva. The site will feature a selection of hand-picked vendors selling everything from technology, jewelry and fashion goods. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_K0HhrzXufBo5FW2YLwT6dAkSQPaXHv983BJHOGVTJERd-H2kvTy33yJ5AhK6f5LTaqGoDCYfGPFvI-BcGthLhaAII13hjvinu9W3Mh5JIKjT1pqYV_NtooOxSEp8YrHJwuJhREPF3hwjLXqv6x_IhtzCQiOm389JJD5CwD9T0brO8kyJKtyeABR_9pic9N9Sxg9KMxIGzP9Q==> . This is big news, and possibly bad news, for ecommerce giants Amazon and eBay, who haven't successfully broken into the Chinese market.


B2C Marketing Automation


Independent, publicly traded marketing-automation firm Marketo reported Q4 2012 earnings and revenue on Tuesday - $28.2 million with a slightly deeper loss than Wall Street expected <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KfdWVKojwSinzSqovAacKKNHurSEYQw3PDe2wb9sbl4I6PjiLhoOcYfRz-h2Ji08hMpZg5c9ooethbJ6BksX1ZaKQjg4Ji-JdQu1bmvWXcATfQBqTs6UErj2IRNw0_ly4w_zYwKH1UTNLlimdUy07_lYu_so3kcpY2cUKMdbqY4pZV8EF2eJ6xz9oVLxt5w0w=> . On the earnings call with Wall Street analysts, CEO Phil Fernandez responded to questions about Marketo's traditional B2B business shifting into B2C: "We're reaching a scale and awareness in the market where B2C customers are coming to us and we expect to lean into that. And we're not in any way backing away from the B2B business, but we'll continue to expect to see increasing growth and traction in B2C." Read the transcript on Seeking Alpha (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KU3PMt5eDWO4hNy_vsbSu9KJpY6hLKGykAoaDAy-BtvgffY6eCXUEJmVjQ8rqADLAL1jnDyLG-Z_M0cFAX9uE_tKmKyUj1H_jqlsrcZlqcuvzPHWr9kl7I3r4u_bnX7G8HKHB4pC2aIfHJ1Y3C7e-LQNki2jNZUu3EFWfvi_ftlLZc_J-xJRypknma_Fob9yKmqwVUTZLVT8pfCnoRHrPo> . And read the earnings release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_LfC323PjFDPcbHAIU03iMsQnr5RrESsd9LwmTbbgX5Z85bTenkgFsULwIXaW1Dvrbj_RjVZ6g19DFdZXf8fkC9_zvy77aozTrZhjY4MtCf-DF4vIfKzg-rg6AeuSAEMbddPXkjMVpvG0yqOlR8rCRVpnkK9ZSGw-TZQymeREESNA==> .

On Facebook Mobile Ad Ax


Following yesterday's AdExchanger story on Facebook pruning mobile ad partners, Gamezebo's Joel Brodie adds more about the two partners who were dropped: "What is not widely known outside the mobile game industry is that everyone uses HasOffers (and to a lesser degree, Kontagent) to track installs. The way it works is that when game developers integrate HasOffers' SDK into their game, they can create multiple URLs to track an install and download, measuring their tracking campaigns to an exact science. I am not saying HasOffers has a monopoly on app tracking, but everyone I know uses them." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_LDaYz_Sa7YdITfHk4qUj9pf_DLPmZU_0Rgmw_Nc5ZlMEMkU3UBMtIf1sKFMr_PEGR8_Etd-MoepkGkomC6irrgp_lbewJHPkapEezvB0LUkMx_HPRhR6XEYY_1XSiLq4kSxe61_-tFo9t_F1zCtvS01lFlvIGruLIKNkKztfiavWsIak8DQtqFp9muAXKkZgPplda4lq681r3wNRomGiUwz-YF_VrmONI4eeRlEVs487pUUCWxcb6cVbxAcoU9SFZgtKnw2UyMzw==> .


Mozilla Eyeballs


A day after Mozilla signaled plans for paid placements <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KeYO_vzKbjZD9KRbkfuWh_-vxsWfdi4ry9lAcImJn-9bK3nx1QjTDKhdD6awJv3Sz7xi1Mru0Uzpxs4BQXU5rXOTyAAvywrU4w4umL_wNp2_cH65Nj3vZ37g4XnB-VvGncJlCehq03lSp5-Japgi8eMEqsOu8_DF6r8L6qRgF4z8PgGpaNxSRvyaj9DfK4_46kYlZ8cGwdQ4WgVM-SBMU9O8Bij3OLCos=>  called "directory tiles," CNET reports on plans to build out content through editorial hires and eventual ad sales. "We would like to broaden our audience as much as we can," said Denelle Dixon-Thayer, Mozilla's general counsel and head of its business affairs group. "Anybody who cares about Firefox as much as we do, we can broaden that voice and make it community-driven." Smells like revenue diversification. More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001cdbPEbMk4_KPMjUTSly1HK1qW_DCKjaEdTMHtdFCwbArUi_iH7N6dLT-mLN_zcQSzZIEMl_QQ9_SaTsbNN3tI18ubYbtjHvXt7_Apwn2mWm_DKL-prhQT3HWfwjNsXTgpQ-skyG-zovt4T6b5f9fCtqV-vuYwaaDmFLVpSAKSar4_peHaAZ1CKlvnollJ87YcDnE6QeK-T1un54dglQKbA==>

*	PROGRAMMATIC I/O, San Francisco, March 24 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeECeW_66dtngd4bdBdKqnedm4pwQzuDhXEba5PmOgkDEOVUnWEwCUocVx9sl9apqlmPBitRwtYuzqX4Ym1_o-U8QnxE6KDzo-y4q1UCc9F7l6qwp3ygKnfC>  - Exploring these questions and more:

*	What's trending in data management?
*	How is 1st party data being used now, as compared with a couple of years ago, in programmatic?
*	How are marketers thinking about, and using, 3rd party data, in programmatic as compared with a couple years ago?
