More Distinctive Guardian


The Guardian is a digital audience powerhouse, reaching 90 million monthly uniques. In an interview with Media Briefing, Guardian Media Group CEO Andrew Miller says programmatic advertising is integral to monetizing that huge audience. Reporter Jasper Jackson writes of Miller, "He claims that a focus on delivering segmented audiences rather than opening up all the Guardian's inventory is increasing the yields. But it isn't all just about making the most of clever technology behind the ads." The publisher is rolling out a unit, Guardian Labs, to offer tools and support for "more distinctive advertising." More. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeFungcn7ZcFHhzKEIaPas6DDzV0f0eyNbkfUtW0Rc3DvjvS2bR6YBH5br80pgZT7H2EDw6aAIX1vHaEhGwiJz08t-uQJA7tMxwBFTRkzHfqtGuy3sbIr2CyDo0VSOlUdTUDvSv9hBEY2vg4nCyWPipp_8zELG__yk-xHWMDkPPQPBsj7rVP-Nr1kbJfU8r5Xf5Jivqk8BEx9Oqnro7Kfa7d> 


In Transition


In his LinkedIn profile, Peter Horan has announced that he has stepped down from his president and COO role at Q&A wiki site Answers <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeGK2w_F8eRgzGMddK-3UNmJpB6PV2PpT8L5FhlKMF7GvFrFfX_KZ--snjJAtId6ZXWRBALz8dCy8Bkf2-mIpDFNWcI-dGG0Sgsb2t1rOlvcXw==> . He writes in his profile, "In February of 2014, I transitioned from working on the daily operations of Answers to being a strategic advisor - still focused primarily on the core issues of monetization and corporate strategy. This enables me to spend additional time with my other portfolio companies." See it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeEsOgkGFM24kUZgAZm59CpkzPJEgwkNDSr9Jqjw1EPWqAGgjyu5UQlt9BYcbEA70nNjadilzUpcSVDCu_0VRM3XzmDA3zYcXr8U-SAaHYX0p83Mu4uHpdT5HAEorxN8Ctc=> .


The Fraud Problem


The IAB was stepping out and speaking out against fraud <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeHjTtnFAcZBraumYFjC7W-HqAeDDexegWcDUBnjB89fAnfJTasx8wZTu2DildfkqVzCCxo0JG1rBGZmu671w7uZqHGmgAgado3V1jPX9sluwM2W036dy4dnlllAirgUULeNXhxFO9MhnSHqFntnR_j3FUjajdTqf7w6Y6KEBMFJOyTyVVMCXePskGWH8OHDxDs8Y8SrqpC-VJRGoNr6lF96lHqtfPvFvJyWu-eWv-nTtKa-tPIxLe1etDzZ3slRD5E=>  at its Annual Leadership Meeting, and as Doug Weaver CEO of Upstream notes, the politically correct terms are being dropped. In order to fight fraud those on all sides of the advertising sphere have to be ready to take responsibility and make changes. He writes, "Unless the IAB defends the third-party cookie, they cede the whole data pie to Google and Facebook; but in defending it, they keep the borders open for the potential bad actors. Hard problem ... much work ahead. But the IAB has a sense of urgency. More importantly, a sense of real leadership and purpose." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeGTUxPHavjD0NiZ-7VyIeM4tnpyu5jLMKzjzUSH_HgHAPrItrXx9mS6I95ttEMZjlDtR-5gywsl-X_HamiswA6vPy8SMi64eRfgTkqkST9vKyB3P_UwFH-NoHJ08Xlflbo=> .


Yahoo Buys Wander


Yahoo has acquired Wander, a startup that makes a diary-like mobile app. The terms of the deal were not disclosed, but TechCrunch estimates that the five-person team was acquired for about $10 million. Wander makes an app for the iPhone calledDays, which lets users share photos and animated GIFs in a package that can be shared the next day. Read more.  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeHBAR1jTv8ulZT3Z6Aw0jYqE_9viZw8D1C6NYeZ9tpHrBPKeKqtnPfpnqLKm3plTORByuL3uZKLcO2Wf6BKMGyGZnJ3y5f8fxp7QKgaVx3NyPoTAH5qS3D73J5nMEPm94tggUVLxv9Y095rRbM97WIMw_R6FJnc3B3L2w4dq_O2MC7084ULdR3QNHC6a9qyzJxIWphBARo4nQ==> The strategy of Yahoo picking up little startups here and there will someday be reviewed - will it have worked? Check back in 3-5 years. CEO Marissa Mayer continues to roll the acqui-hire dice in the meantime.


Social TV Race


Cracking the social TV space is a top priority for Facebook and Twitter, and Facebook just announced another step toward realizing this goal. The company has partnered with SecondSync to measure TV chatter, and released a white paper analyzing how different countries use Facebook to talk about TV. "We're very excited to be partnering with a company of SecondSync's caliber," said Fred Leach, Facebook's head of measurement R&D and partnerships. "We look forward to being able to share a wealth of insight with the broader industry regarding the dynamics of how people talk with their friends about TV on Facebook." Read the post <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001b9gFA8QXqeGNS3YcipUFDEeZ0O3XPBM5VB5pGl3JJi2Y3PPnsxdriANZ44T815poqKBGpY_Uv-_4CKVWv7N7UJasmwkspzmlWoXK2vX5t7X9Ra6XAuujyfoCcvyabAFnQWZ6YN5lbLclucLRmOK33lpenWwps0GfQQyuKmCsCcA624yy3cAy5b8VqVJRZ6PPwqwfQewCpcc=> .

Extreme Reach Closes Deal


After months <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmS0WCJkpFZr_hPyzx-_-rHlow4wJivJNjrb0VB7lTCilLgqiuw5eDe5ICiUnUiZMzTc5IUpUhq9kjdbn1gExl7TF3DjEoNSKqwC37C_WN54lef9KwBFoK_ayrqlBhB07x6f-8dethnW8cnuZHgPEu3WuclDPCoSjy7TLKiJvv0kA5TnTUx5H38BpIBOycnLHcqn8QQOnPNGPxLrBtsykaDpwKw5K3FZd9ulzuzpSKo4KQ==>  of anticipation, Extreme Reach on Monday closed its $485 million acquisition of its former competitor, Digital Generation's (DG) TV advertising business. Read the press release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmS1FjDNeWspT9s4z7P3G-EibB4l-G0X5w7LuTSk_ZI3xj5vUkPzHO_uw0h5p1WjcbUkHlcuhUAk_CGXdEOKk31-O4FyAGyAoms1ciax-MdQNn9i4HtD-KfuScs46XAHxCSmodhNyWya6tXpIVSbI1w1ruupBzAuSYg=> . DG, for its part, rebranded  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmRzTPLQsO-Sx9JOOYQCyMJren9fjgwWAc1unMJflYPa5jW_OJUyh5FS7OtMRCTJuk1o_HPW4MA60fpMj2QkFtudYDwEYAfh-llFPz6dH5xx_2ALP_TcuurugTfRZdYVwcNxxCrNBRDKiUaKq4Pst4kEtCqBxSYLaTc=> as Sizmek after jettisoning this line of business. So what's next for Extreme Reach? Boston Business Journal speculates  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmRakefwZw_G2xYteVmjKxIbWdrM3ClikPb_nd47gGA1c-RHktpWU8RZH993gL7Ur0GCT-SW77xe1TWUpkINuQXV9IRFoCCwCBzCx87bAxVvRZ5fHgU96yCPmOxzUh9sKsnDi9xecn7Sn9auNVhA8whGGYODaimRuB_gAdw2tpnEhSCUgCL6RO2Q-Z2wCmnPiRgC0TldmI6gJACuYRfun561> that the company might be prepping for an IPO. Extreme Reach says it will continue to pursue the "TV and online video advertising convergence" with its range of solutions.


Funding Local


Location-based data and advertising company PlaceIQ raised $15 million and announced a strategic partnership with Publicis' VivaKi. By teaming up with VivaKi, all of the Publicis agencies will have access to PlaceIQ tech and data, says the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmTvgnWnMM3hBM0P3HVUeAR7CU6hD7giSuSeXjJwSgPCjI4kc6V-jksPDqwDuiuA3RZg-VEG1ya1-LRewlCRxxSCnPPde_qXBTXAJ095V_5rsPHmxfm5mf2PbG-2XAW4TlLvtM6J5DuRKQV4OuKTkNE4saDDHoxyL3WsGrNvXZnpi0sNdG_ipX_YVCrmny6uuqUmrZ5jWyZjVcdT1e2poiW2kvW9yxyBIoe82iBAyBaqyJqdZqGeq_C_Glqr8bC5Py1-NE1BjfR4zA==> .


50% Programmatic In 3 Years


Marc Lomas, who was part of the executive team that started programmatic buying at IPG Mediabrands, is now managing director of IPG's Cadreon in Australia, according to B&T. "Programmatic buying is proving highly effective and efficient for many clients, hence its explosive growth. We have some way to go to achieve the 50% of total spend in the next three years, but we are on target," Lomas said in an interview. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmQ9StNShICOO6tgWV_ReNupOm2RlWCiKMs_JB4sqWaxl24JC4cwhm67LFcpqIPmayyHLTY8VwuSSFCIkyhcXAvHmQDPVqXOgsW_uuHNlCQbcZ1u2_zXOMjiBR5fWf9TVx19-3nDFmO8E4T-Ak7SuJILK7x4kVXXUMNQxasFaRfIgQ==> . Also in the region, demand-side platform MediaMath opened an office in Singapore. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmSOia7JGpfvZyWVpnCsua5CGsed09YQSYuBHu9NT-qxXHBZ7_yU5pKfuIXw4WOHiIXXb_fgp8KlswZ7DJTeiNvE7sUVb5xtOD_snUJpVvRuM-iHv5Bx82SbG1DStgSa_Z8s5OlwSkpr7AjWvZTqn4thbtz5bNdTbZamwb71ywfirjA2Y1RkL2oJiN9zrHjTqRIl5oSF7Vahqq-EtcoCiPcQ0erkX3R2FhMG4Ow_RGcN5GMb1G7IsFVpihgwpgWPeVR49DEE2xnveQ==> .


Agile Marketing


Technology and data are driving mobile advertising success, says Forrester analyst Thomas Husson - but there's more to it than that. He writes, "For mobile marketing to succeed, you must deliver your brand as a service, implementing more-personalized and more-contextualized brand experiences on mobile phones - but you can't do it alone." Get agile <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmRtjmaL2lWdSf9t6SLTs7Opm8ZBBv130PgHVXC6wFgsnA1Vm81Izz-Ru5ge5UJYu6Zn2iCjW3Kvg63AN4-Of42Ga5lxOer1I2FGfgjPKZhJ_AHx-0WWGUohDMOuo97oGsBndR39hcZfCaIdZH3dvbsLLJ4DygHNOYfz6KPhBJDUz9YOe48UHiYS05BCi_p9nwsX8BozlMBDog==> .


The Naylor Has Landed


Peter Naylor will be joining Hulu as senior vice president of sales, according to a blog post by CEO Mike Hopkins. Naylor was executive vice president of ad sales for NBC News Digital, and during his time with NBC he worked with Hulu on identifying charter advertisers. According to the blog post, 2013 was a record year for Hulu in terms of consumption. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmQ_nzj5S_CqgOSpZ7bOf7iA5JlgB3oy0u4E_B8-Eff2584pjLxeDCcRzupDAFvlwNFMGQbUCfUvuEWDojPba9AYTMUk1YVLEs6u0dMRweRKk8tWNKaMcjZWK29X_AIAyykqF63ImeD6CGIDkf0av9kktIMZlM4p5FwI113IPE7YLIKu5Z1Qkjdl> .

The Mobile Movement

 

At the IAB Annual Leadership Meeting, mobile was front and center, and publishers are now urging advertisers to produce creative using HTML5. The group of publishers that sent a special letter to advertisers included AOL, Forbes, The New York Times and more, according to Ad Age. From the letter: "To guarantee the ads you pay for actually appear and look great on all screens, you should insist to your ad agencies that your advertising creative be developed in a mobile-compatible format. And the one open, industry-standard, universal format for building mobile-ready creative is HTML5." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmQvzXqy7DTstEAJt0k1ufoH7-6PqU-LCxyBxszxHudebwvkPQT_48W8vfpkKiR6UNt-2IyRYniYVL_aEr9BPrfsvtvnj5-cAZAGUERUPR5pViGHmsdqWSUwYTBG4oPqhrckx3CCWrg2JqXvLjK4yOgrjKcPEcy4vKsZtr__1B4SJ3QdgEjEdW4CN8abO_gyKML3dKbKZe1nj-_DI42XFM-kRjpQti13f-o=> .

 

Cookie Study

 

A new study conducted <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmTdAwpJ15nT0HRPXJY6DP0xmLAISynjj3Tw3Pqchtc9Fjek2ul19HqbH-mRFlwc57YhohnCYG1ih3-SgKuZFHyOWoHFClpDliA-EXvvrIpuuVhoOv8_Je08nGaurnLwi73BV0QLcda0JO3juFVAG_lQoSLS11e_rwo=>  on behalf of the Digital Advertising Alliance revealed that ads based on cookies are more valuable than those without cookies, and this is especially true with small publishers. "The study vividly demonstrates how data and relevance, based on responsible data collection and use, are increasingly essential to the existence of a thriving, ad-supported Internet," DAA Managing Director Lou Mastria said. "The added economic value generated by the conscientious use of data directly benefits consumers by sustaining innovative services and diverse content online." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmQ8PIUxFNURD9ZkukoJ2vhMgQho_YWca1H8BxJIFDMl70OCIdFcoil9tKVKgDzN6JaXIzghAf6BFFNmb-G5g84UEcEt2k7YksSDJ7EdSAy5urVFB__wJSL3j4Y3IdNopUkU176bwr4vfcJscNgHZi6SQGbf02j2P_dumPRj7ZQ_tHJy-F5GLQikkBB7r1tBg70w7S_xZ5dB-E5L9oitiWLr7vZ8-gxEkoa0cJxnnKWZUYc9MJPRnJB_> .

 

DoubleVerify Buys Antifraud Tech

 

Verification vendor DoubleVerify has snatched up the assets and IP of antifraud vendor RealTargeting. RealTargeting was founded "to uncover the sophisticated methods behind the illegal practices of online ad fraud. Its CEO Aaron Doades will join DoubleVerify's product team. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001dEXYTBRcGmRydg_udSR0UUpGHJ32h1yNCLP7ZNR-tFLyuM7JBgY6zjD6KulgvLgPvRLW9WtZ7ivqR3leRxu4VFBq6LEGoyzEZvbn2qAyPPefgOToIqx9qZ3bXwT0aWa9kQaES1oP3m966kZM3lYlml1TgzQmU9sEuCDtZd4pl46Px0J79sAYs8fMJ3TumXLAXYnHaMg9IS6bo_7BPK9K5Vit7ZnZzp7Em-EDnd6y2CH5gesb3OCndO2IFo3hJQTljTXV2UvE1_Q=>

Tapping Bankers


Not to be outdone by the plans of <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA0t0T09aJ39TSqGr0NQfKyqYjHwFVeelHa14NrghZlaOBw1G6Qp-Ic5jX-fSdSdM92_Ci7KLN_mZsHjFoTQEmMq3p62llBJUeKFE4feH1HFv-Fb20M7kuJxwK1Uq64vVInGg_x11oZkcUYzmySiKQmPSqTIh8-Ykel-vCR175gNGeatfcQX_fDy5mopkSf5Ua_Ryucr8oA67g0dIeLhbgTy>  competitor Rubicon Project, sell-side platform PubMatic is now taking its IPO aspirations to the next step, says The Wall Street Journal. The WSJ's Telis Demos writes, "The company is working with Credit Suisse Group AG and Citigroup Inc. on the offering, which could come later this year, the people said. It will aim for a price that values the company at more than $1 billion, they added." Read more (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA3yMZGoO6wFgbodu0LU0Ub2aBj814v6Sea7V89-z1oyvHluRbm7dl8LZv2jenGptqMo62q0mhebATN2Xbq1EXfzRbdIOPmiQk6oQc1yYaQT-fI8I0Fo2PGLVhK4_KK8JRLxYvhKNFOLRQ0ABvhN_hBdjI4bzpsePLN9phteTHEOChH_tEVfQNYT7UyWaK6BzBriEFWi9iPu7NNZZR-D0qxLU_lcejTrYqia0vb9csDtSQ==> .


Brand Exchange


Google wants to get brands on board with programmatic and is working with certain companies on "custom brand exchanges." The idea is the same as a publisher exchange, but in this case Google would gather up a number of brands then match them to certain publishers. "We're trying to create effectively a curated network for these advertisers using the best inventory these publishers have to offer," Aaron McNally, market development manager at Google's DoubleClick Ad Exchange, told Ad Age. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA1L5eozqtT9-ejUcz3gAtMzNGn1u1Lqsa6_ZDGxzRbGb_L4jhwib85U7eVmj7euGHeicRiJs67rUD3r7ZhcBVg0-2mCG5cIEDw7S6XyLO21nYEffksigYNvWfqsLYrcdCUX5ygUCYZbwClImAr9uzhXGDAGPBHFdMZw3AT0R12uwt9mOB40TY6Nk3a2LGh1qUkoWV32Mdr24UAQyiKFVeiH> .


Visualizing The Datasets


In the Columbia Journalism Review, Ryan Chittum takes mainstream-ish media charts to task for purporting to show the decline of The New York Times Co.'s business. Chittum explains, "The Times has very real problems, thank you very much, but they're not this bad. This is a good example of a chart that's technically accurate, but really misleading, and a warning about using datasets out of context." Read and see it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA01-iIVhJay6tQnSfSaCJZ1jHW8ey4kfjkm2P3bgwZPKbbur4_cqmN5CcNNeu7Pw30nYGosQ5WB-ZIIZc5UCXD3Y1Ib_iTGc-jwPDBt0amD-nmAOMgd_w1pq8g9gzJavUhPdLnvqhaVtYphH5iHJl-hcxDn65tVdR0=> . And, read more from AdExchanger about the NYT's ad year ahead <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA2r-Ar3ewPYdOE7kqPp__l4rkf1G5UGDLzyG8aaKl-GR-AKWNxG0DHoypD4DlHFZ7BOO6SlDjIiYK2ID8Ad2lNUGxhQyf26Iw5vqFjBgg2kVJcvkmJKOa5o6_Ly0lRty4svRaLcZT1H4uzH0spB5CV8WmT3WaVtVelad79ix_2EoLvIWmcH3ayZqcIW2wQwdACSCPsXbCty67GTXjCXihs8> .


Buying Video Tech


The acquisition of contextual video advertising technology firm SET Media <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA0EVs_SYJ1HN2AoakauU1tMvRSrlNclwthpqCVMjQ06vrt1G0E9mwg-8-1CBTsM8i_rg1vl_jKsM1TOjujcR3J8UwLOfSrAMGLCLUVo8CfiiA==> , formerly Affine Systems, has been completed as of Thursday by Conversant (AdExchanger article) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA2arb0HQ_tinJsedAT24KJ3pvF2cGKY7S5YjyRslmWVQN99oUZYR8VR5XqRMpHxpxp_3RQ7FLGcsH5fzo-Lu1eixaySPEiO88xAZ228NMPTTl1JZq5i6w5EtUihacTt6Dh3gAftE6S7t3c9TMq_2B1n6RjGRMJFSnn6ZU-FFDqZamMv0ss0SBDRfO5hHg7TszTI60XGWeTIlSHkGI14jIlM> , formerly ValueClick Media, according to a release. The acquisition's value is $31 million claims <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA1_jRE2a14vYdLhEfgcstCxuK9cT4UVlRF4HpnSR7OjRAEz95Ik7gJh8cjVpLabkVEr0hULFJJf7COjIf7mEkDPyEC8OsEivQYFDa8hUmRvu3b4VX_6zQKFGODcSFK1vkM=>  Crunchbase. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA1217DN7dr6pq3sOJwqJGky4SwH19wHKkVIrDR6f4CyzI9sP36GLqDL4CEUAG2jiJikNoJ6KyzQE9g4lK6umRPbYeLoWUTxkXErVsIsRSijuptnJ6EWczOkm6kidl3gSk3FbVYjr72Uv2YIwHCcvQeujmQjhN7sAAjCTOuP2dZCcBpdaJzBGXC5bHMxTDucUyVBPUsd_FTJNoL3Ao3ZOyeFcEwNjjEugPJy8DaAxzeRcg==> . SET CEO, and former YuMe CEO, Michael Mathieu will join Conversant's executive team. Four years ago <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA3vBagf0pJ9d4YeDT1rZ36QDI8X5U9j7SmbGQTuknKURTsWC3VJDJ9ZiCirGHiOUEsgm6P2ln39K1RUThA4kCt-99qDeo7GZxWmvV6eOsMsIC5J8yIQt3n8y8Lu-GNEh9iq6uWfqXcOtfmP698rfIl5vtzRrCyBzrOHVqk1zTx4chXbc-5Qg-CSBFTr-5LWKTk6O9J1YA5GQrsibjJjLUB_JxVZw4iiGF8fNdnt3yIHZclek5eJ96xzyqsL2w9_SAxG_Ie5PUjm7Q==> , Affine Systems tech was supplied to companies like AOL's video ad marketplace Adap.tv.


The Scarlet Paragraph


Search Engine Land spies a new disclaimer Google had to apply to its search home page for users in France for, apparently, a couple of days. Search Engine Land's Danny Sullivan tells the story: "The home page of Google France now carries a notification to users that Google was fined for privacy violations relating to the 'unified' privacy policy change it made in 2012." He adds, "A required link to the ruling against it might also be slowing the site of the French privacy agency." See a screenshot <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA35rj3H2wEzhvGIl1emSSEbVfq1vGBBBu25QuJ_gSZdAehendnt4NklszPWBB-RJaGv65KNQXWrdWwI8CC2VqpyhwoQ5Z_H-dzBFjv-pQteA-L5BKFBVUi4bWJgMESc4OjGQEG_HjmTxTi_-ptcWCBqqPGHs66yvALWdj9fOrKicA==> .

Sponsor Message

Align Marketing Strategy with Consumer Expectations <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA3zuHEtJOvM-53C68Z9YoDGxEI7hf3gVLaxjbrb6WY4EIq5k0wi-rna4ccn5SPf2bqusNqLx9qlcUaDdN9PAWKZujqPp03Qr69aseVA_OPR6jAKWfARSg_eKgTw14fEAnU=> .

Consumers And Services


In a post on his personal blog, Sovrn <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA21VR2ACyZisoXJfihXUawNewDA2oZmfZQ8UuMjZ7qGzwFqJV7u7Nwt1KdcEQ341KMcmxU3BDWsz0xB_P0t1ishDy6bltsxGsA=> 's (was Federated Media and Lijit) executive chairman, John Battelle, reviews Rubicon Project's "independent" market positioning - not Google - from its S-1. He admits he has skin in the game with his own firm and says, "Over time, we won't be talking about 'publishers' and 'advertisers,' we'll be talking about 'consumers' and 'services.' And the infrastructure that connects those two parties should not be a default - it should be driven by competition between independent players." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA3c-sO1gBZqk6BWeve_l0I2_T-MX2Aaw3kiRZwW9Xv_3zJM3PX7GTcaIGzVacE49i7qly6-9ahZC-8CaZVle8V6PgcP3fIVJXg-e6VZ0I_WgnGvQ54M8yii79EP1Lw4rhjL_Snat40mzo751IjF3rHu2QueFsDlQXZVoLhEhemQNa-oC5ZAGevcdbLVNT7OvXg=> . And read a Forbes article on the transformation of Battelle's company here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001T9d2qg5ZVA17h5n1slqM31s-R4qHf7M0KJqpCNzCkGREn9l-3Ie7XioE3rHLZeS6i9nFlibHLU9uDg1Syf4HfUGi4-1j8u7PhoJjt08GN1e5wQIRvtrAXld-Lxk73cXMyz3P80pi-0rMRoHNIKjxcjCwng343Mc_ar5S6aiRt8J9888uMGygXdWr7lBiXVh4SbOlFnDFhcTnis0e4I5TFdkfh-zRVML68jeSQOKAiHq9JRP7wLyolXTQPYf-4Veg> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK44lR8c9PX8KMyQDtiAzNu1kaYDkysq20FSsl8LUQEQ7r6h8obnzhUBEz3kXlCP_i7wvMjTRIwLF8KuVaFnn0oPcgnqUaYj42Y082aHdMKdtbF_-W5adGXsFba8gERTTKA=> .

 

Ad Limitations


The openness of the online advertising industry has allowed in sites of all types, and as Randall Rothenberg points out in an article for Business Insider, this could threaten the whole system. The solution, according to Rothenberg, is to have strict guidelines for sites that want to serve ads and preventative measures against fraud. He writes, "We must create an all-inclusive program that identifies qualified participants, and commits them to good actions, guaranteed by continual monitoring and sanctions for non-compliance. We must make it clear that doing business with unqualified companies subjects customers and shareholders to undue risk." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK4_urxOZskAd9VURsVVBKKRgYZDGdwYM0GcJQKfMgV0F90AMe9gxNwhlUDc2DnAeufO3Bd5zXSt8CETlJQ_fMNMIhbPMWHLbXrwkZ4khVgXGAVAMG4i6XBM_2ajywH_VTXNgk3I3CZX9aqCzvhYh5GisPK7P8GH7XaYxRvf1FiaXQ==> .


Microsoft's Local Data


Microsoft is putting faith in Foursquare's data, offering it a $15 million investment. As GigaOM points out, Foursquare has struggled in the past with revenue, but last month the company was able to raise $35 million. Microsoft will be able to use Foursquare to enhance searches through Bing. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK5ixQZQQUx4nEWmKRAn4t-K9_ic0B27AMCVX5KRbM4pg0Nvad8v5bjkOoUhhn2T12ySc_38KLHC9ycOb8aPwCxQuGGkjPfJHF00DQE4e0vm03UurqkCx264nSQ4fNL0UNOpogdXkqmJHQvUO2tRnZcvnkQT8il8zFCxMFziZn6XfLGSPRqhQiTpmA_De22sPF1ntfY1ADCL3eTdV_UID2Du> .


Omniture Founder Funds


Domo, founded by Josh James, just raised $125 million, according to TechCrunch, which puts the company's value at $825 million. James is no stranger to success; he founded Web analytics SaaS company Omniture, which was sold to Adobe in 2009 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK4E2g6HuLdFSh6-sA536T_gHRZUmuW_C0OftcTXYjgpSx-g9j7_DjD4Rs8CJks5fXsZ1E7bJ6asK9PbeEsgQNLpx7r1bF_RngK-rxsJe97OHuTdX6oRwhB0qt5TAFtSSIQHQMkI4QaBH1uTmujLQpPMGchIdummBS1P6VKfBbRk2Jwy1eAropYsIPATpQh_rIH-wn6UIYGVBQ==> , and has also survived a near-death experience <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK5Xq8JetvBX0GOhAPmxGISNPJ7gz0jl_t6QZnhULl4nBpQcWj9wt6-e1ezZpPMR6TIlr9yBDO52DLGmSIJ8LLVos-1ljhE3S4Ppa7tLMT7DGXA4NYUQ1AYqgxPzMQsrPdMcTmT4E1w1ue3rC5QPJtqxd1dZT9kohv43KNZxVAuyuQ==> . Domo is a business intelligence company that allows companies to make decisions in real time. Salesforce.com is one of the investors in Domo, which reportedly has around 500 customers. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK7dHD3RHttaAFrZbEMBvheIrQ0SfcPVvUnLE07UKl5QrbP3liczs1ZjGykXHqmgtfdy8rdVA7SwCkMY-weL9ZtDlvwvULLdsvkqR8qaDKmMiCe85dvdaXYG_yrvWEuD-TdDdcu0yATMoFTNzuQTFywR9VwDtOWpFuTkrTe4_o3zTRRyRWQmQgsuFH1QVCEQw0npGVATahUhMmyG-oNJM0ZHVsl8vglH7WyA1BkQNAjp5sKe6UJ0jjTCu0VU0LkFlTs=> .


Amazon's Video Future


Amazon's video capabilities are growing opening up a new advertising channel, which it plans to capitalize on through FreeWheel. According to Re/code, the video ads may also feature "Shop Now" and "Learn More" features, making them even more lucrative. "What we're seeing and hearing is that our advertising partners are very, very interested in working with us to make the customer experience that much more relevant with video," Amazon's Lisa Utzschneider said. Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001Uqb9TOLUdK7nYZ3Jq4O0KmL78m0aHEURoWDtK-6p5yoVJeNNmTBr3vbxcl5-XxKxE_GkrUmMW5QutA7ULpeWjxqSd24Q8AVjZ02K8Hdj1pirayvSVn_p0l98DAlZ8rlWzYRg3T8rfCbft0nDvdHPEKTaH9KLpwwByIL51yjsvScVFr1LZBQdS48s9JXzUbsV_DUCzOsu8mhTctddGrD7SA==> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ0xO2cImyLP_L4V7yq8jdyunvGc1lenHomy-mnHok67xvSQ-WZaYXU7MVvyF5FQ5UHgNky2YzYA1qTdmo_6bVbzXKPr29YEhr2Na9deVNl8qob2WHjJXE4oj6D1LlzmyZg=> .

 

Satya Nadella, Ad Man?


The question is irresistible: What does Satya Nadella's CEO appointment auger for Microsoft's advertising business? One of his many promotions was to corporate VP of the the search, portal and advertising platform group, so he has some fluency in digital ads. Combine that with his cloud experience and there may be a recipe for a grand entry into "marketing tech" a la Salesforce, Oracle and Adobe. The key AppNexus relationship is another area to watch. Press release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ08Dus5eChKFEJXs6aaNoCohrR79LnwCzlFjGbFHpt3W6vPgzyowuR73bE89dglfFMlc6QBGhlWQhAouiuSEvGvckxJLeMxYJiQ0nYbnPF4zCLYWYbynmnd6ejlADZh9Riz7jgZdIq0YLshbLONLAOtN6g-d78loZ9c9UpL7t61yKOhzvQSJig3>  Danny Sullivan notes that Google, Microsoft and Yahoo now all have "search" CEOs - read that one <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ1e6j6lyI0OKrM1QXhJZebUnIOFiHM_zvYeiyA72uUgfKNNQAcnod5Eo5Zf5H3J4K2OVTiawgHX7LvmTuOAIjUIBtnAId8jiw6mSeAtXtcC2ZvkY2AZGjZ86r8sRe_SxTlmH_gOIcidig==> .


Programmatic TV's Future


Programmatic is infiltrating every part of digital marketing including display, social, mobile and video, but the next frontier is smart TVs, says Rocket Fuel's UK client strategy director, Joel Christie. He told The Drum, "Smart TV is going to enable programmatic buying across the TV platform and this is where the future lies for the industry. This will allow for better brand opportunities, better insight and full screen solutions - a move that will change the industry forever." Read the rest <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ2FqJREUiSLzY62LkIXIxP_7gXmXOo666g0Ewe2KNHyLroE3ZhuV28SQkoQw0j22JFcqdSWOSH_kymZlFzvH6yt1yen5aHOeTIC4xSg-NbdYh06o_yupQ3-YcnISWPIqrSiJBJAyaQaw2n1IfE_2kT7GU2edHDAv7uunTf75kH9wpYM5qai7xM0LYdNDc5fEZeO9GDAUe_D3oiYRZEaWFZDGiOHvVyTpuaF8b2Us7d7bsa9_baUrQ6G> .


Shared Responsibility


When it comes to data breaches, retailers want the government to understand that it's not a problem exclusive to that industry, according to Ad Age. The National Retail Federation produced an ad that states only 24% of security breaches occur at retail and restaurant companies. "One of the problems is that during these more recent discussions, there has been a lot of pointing of fingers and a lot of that has been pointed toward the retail industry. It's important for us to point out consistently and frequently that we're not the only industry that's up against data breaches," said Bill Thorne, SVP for communications and public affairs at the NRF. "It's not a problem for retailers to solve alone." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ2QeTQT9-kSdZPBcLi6gjg7YOFV-IyjOFxIXX7ODgKluLfsWxuKZQPQhNdTM_WAI2lgniRqVv-Ao_gTBVboqKEKfniGW0s0ylN-0Qsr6TAaB53XECX4x4m-LM1C4N_rU_d4Wrs67qmtZox0p3b_1g44tTs8w7G-Gll6y9CzXJ5y6AGUJCMSlHdla9C14sbxOsg=> .


Mature Programmatic


Programmatic buying is taking the advertising industry by storm and in the UK it represents 17% of total display sales, according to Dominic Joseph, chief executive of Captify, in a column for Media Week. It all comes down to the data, says Joseph, who urges that in order to make programmatic more effective advertisers must think at a more granular level. He writes, "To take a more mature approach to programmatic buying, there needs to be a shift from big data to smart data." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ0nA8kYih2jAaX5zszqhLYLIqetNRnG6y40TAmMzAro6rZWhNpZ9FKPPr8VZuEPAp4GmcS_0RPPAviUP2EHc_8OZF74xqtOPgo-1nX72r39a9OQ88ica3jku78gCnUfN4RwNp2vD-NazIt1SzwhUidZqt9pW-JoU0HPmAMkbF6YHyWZPBm_ikWk> .


Deep Link SDK


Deep linking gives marketers the chance to link to a specific part of a page, which is helpful on mobile devices where users are more likely to get fed up with having to search around a page. Deeplink.me, developed by Cellogic, has been steadily gathering users and TechCrunch is reporting that the company has launched an SDK for app developers. The "AI" buzz phrase of the moment is evidently in play: "By having this AI engine, we're going to understand more what people are doing in their apps. We're going to start recognizing patterns," said CEO Itamar Weisbrod. "What we're taking into account is how you use the apps you have on your phone, and how that plays with how we recommend what app to go to next." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001jNp1PL8vsQ2nKCtJw1WRWWpgWcZ477SQQnpEn1wvD_j2U13FUoaJ65PnJEwQL2e7KdeL236--EE2dwkFTIJNhpgzNQy87X4fp30k34_vNhiEOeGm46QgwSd0ZifMISPGLTsAbSo-h7-go_18sAMfkG49H9jKhd0I4muzwlrIrbqRmhlPGsIoj7mCsc4Zhd5Fe3OiELZ9jhuwIo9B2PhdwbebU_je6GKq> .

 News Round-Up <http://ih.constantcontact.com/fs116/1102602719219/img/94.jpg>   

Here's today's AdExchanger news round-up... Want it by email?
Sign-up here <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVynuymzVN0jf-JwSmDZ5JFXKyCSc2Q8Xz3RymfrojAug99ARACVpgDEWVpKTEk81rbq8zqW9yQhty6fRfl2S2ab5u-ksD2rC98ML1LBBroxWNyt1N6YHZfCfAsk5Q2yG1c=> .

 

Digital Beats TV


In Australia, IPG Mediabrands says that TV spend will be overwhelmed by digital ad spend in 2014. The Australian Financial Review observes the details: "IPG Mediabrands has forecast an 'explosion' in mobile advertising over the next five years. 'There is a complete disconnect between the time spent with mobile devices and the ad dollars being directed to the sector,' IPG chief investment officer Victor Corones says. 'It's just going accelerate more and more as publishers discover better advertising solutions.'" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVyHOoi58QRBp8bPM4wo3wG-hRD5USajChGpZUwH4HHzNjEVUIyQ6eXniCDGoiztgpn3iro-SHt15KdjuOwVRucm7QfOksmvUmAgrKQx98zSRCwZPCGGOy5ekBEtHgNcmFXlD4kiJCMiiiyzMF17A5LtsCGZiYg27gddIRS7mKw-ljQodwp1E4Z9H4LtwmddL3FSwSNLBStC9g==> .


Ad Refresh


Some publishers are turning to auto-refreshed ads to boost ad sales, but advertisers may not be as keen on the idea of their ads being rotated out, Digiday points out. "When we buy an ad, we expect the ad to not change until the user refreshes the page," said Media Kitchen president Barry Lowenthal. "These kinds of auto-refreshes also reduce viewability, which of course we're all trying to avoid. I think it's a shady way to increase revenue." Instances where auto-refreshed ads make sense would be on a gaming site, for instance, which has users on the site for hours at a time. Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVxsUK9hBMihtEXVo9gerchCqM4r8gThO5f0n5ZNFwA5UatrPjyMELAhsfLbfND4QKrxs9Ig2Bl1z4uu4yPbl1J9uXgREdXeZYmKhj99LinB1qEZzd5oQU7tdALFu6BpKNi3-pYWH6kJuRo3TP_MehWg> .


Twitter Data Mine


Thomson Reuters is mining Twitter streams from third-party sources to build sentiment analysis and visualization into its Eikon market analysis and trading platform, according to TechCrunch. The company is not working directly with Twitter, but this just goes to show how useful Twitter's data can be. Bloomberg did something similar when it incorporated tweets into its data stream, and companies like Dataminr and CNN are also taking advantage of the breaking news aspect of Twitter. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVyi789ggkttd5Sr-kS8lyXQsXdZg-cu7JTHLKBO9e0rBD2CQ1P0Wf8r7Yy1muqe9DmBPlqTzeyzG8GxTMRQnJ4cQYvxN4moY9aidaw8_dCZrUOkU2WXZILSnwwIG6urTGRHjoRH0kAEkzrQh5UP4-bJnv03xh9G_m4mhlcO8ZqseQaxZ8DdDkgCQ5FXlYHPKI-NYbH85R2qqM0A15ipE2qWJkaqUIvApG1hih2K2XYjLA==> .


Super Bowl High


Advertisers spend a lot of time and money preparing for the Super Bowl, and Nielsen's latest data proved that this was the most-watched Super Bowl, with 111.5 million viewers. According to Adweek, Super Bowl delivery records have been broken four out of the last five years. Despite the fact that the game was a blowout, people still tuned in. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVziGWVbAbd5ptpUaZ9V31_MI63xIaSZLbJmUocgeBL3gTz91U0VHBcjwKEXqr3eyvHqY10AW774bswMSSpVsNGptFjKOehkWyP-2BGK6r5_JjB6xDd1Cb9aCsL951wLPHyFOfu8QvoPZ5h7P_6uXwWTOrSy8Hm0-8as9NvOP_bpZBtjYil6Da4pYpOepPSDLLg=> .


Set-Top Data


Working with TV set-top data poses a complex set of problems. Simulmedia CTO Alison Lowery describes some of them along with their solutions in this four-part video interview with Charlene Weisler. When Simulmedia first began to chase down such data,it was "stuff they were basically throwing on the floor." Since then that data -- volume and rewind data, record data, program choices and other user actions, to name a few -- has been largely productized and standardized. Watch. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=0015tjoGzdEkVwIWQqBeq2Tng4cLv-RAiJfrtfd1erTPETCO0wQ3hFC4_ptj8rwb11Afdc9-NgY9DrMT5EeZME2hLAs2PlOGHOgDedv73DvfCTKl0htS3BHBTOsd-s7EnMAespVvQlHWQhL5ZI_HBnLg1687ePluz1zX2Dz16TvfHVisZpfeSOqsZRGNqBI7GgX>

Patent Sweep


After enduring the threat of a lawsuit <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnulE7lAj2tKiDmDd1O-gXcrB74aCbSqqW6pDPgRVjNsjj99Xol5Ae1Zg9c8qagN0nN27st0ecH3e3zd6mViFWGjpHCH6-SDK0mHkxMe6JVupNcG-ZxuNlmfSGRfr-4YDfLeuCMDViDnNVS4HzL8HX-aS0qK4JwTf577PVqMHFhlvte5ZOFBPDHs> , Twitter acquired more than 900 patents from IBM, which has led the list of patent recipients for the past 21 years, according to a news release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOntlqObdlfYXQxPhI90Fo0gw6A8frXAV4ZSq5uTA8Q5CUl3gjHVk4-gnAnZJ7uUB_jvbkqCqkCjKGIYYI5z6CQ_WlTyoXjlzaw8T3w13H8gLC74lwPCzYgNVd5-INpKErsfw4kRijOn-9LHkJELIdCJdH1y3rk1ZbIc=> . TechCrunch <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnuTiAB_pPM6iQaxySOhgMYO0I4eBOTSa6idyiuEbjovoFMg2JIBW0aS-9Ol9jzdSNiU4C3CEZuEQpHPh6JsWwG_279RPTY7dVweiHOvGdqwzRtXS3SLBL6AQXF8aODLpIIw_vO8bIOMSQz0KEOGl-PmNpxTpnlTHRtMpRLaG99mfg==>  points out that this isn't the first time a tech company has purchased patents from IBM; both Facebook and Google have done so. "We are pleased to reach this agreement with Twitter because it illustrates the value of patented IBM inventions and demonstrates our commitment to licensing access to our broad patent portfolio," said IBM's Ken King.


CDO Infiltration


The number of chief data officers at agencies continues to grow, and Gartner predicts that by 2015 25% of large global organizations will have one on staff. The number of CDOs has doubled since 2012, and most of the roles are in the US. Gartner suggests CIOs view the CDO as a partner with data-management knowledge and skills. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnuwqyWtmYc943-lsOi71DPtcltbPATfYpLRnfSzkPYGxlb8C88lQeHU1n8BkIuas6scEejHtIPZNBtl33Em-wp8uui-SZ12hM98GTX7PuVe6Sue7XYNIAUOr-Hxrcd1EMUWSc1PfuGgLw==> .


The Data Play


Facebook is establishing itself as a major player in the advertising world after reporting record revenues and profits in Q4 of 2013. The company's social data is luring in advertisers, but its market share is still a small slice of the overall digital pie. "The smart brands learned to use Facebook to create demand, and Google to fulfill demand," Bob Buch, chief executive of social advertising company SocialWire, told The Wall Street Journal <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnsckFXkgqLtjPQfUE-QCxexNH-j8-zZ2bEvGsxFig1Cqe0gwKNqyoBBw__3I2NHJwNUq9X8dWwWwbEWo9Qk1vybsSKr7xkyVaPdwIQS-AFuqBS-vu7g97JLgQ5veQOCtl8t7j6ok_V9VI-38jlicn2lv0A7R6cIj-wkICM_GAPbr3Z3TA47O_f3aLGsMtCRQIU=> .


Viral Ads


Malware is making its way into ads and infecting users' computers -- and this is something new -- according to an article from The Wall Street Journal. Although ad servers from Google and Rubicon Project have fraud detection systems in place, it's impossible to catch every one, notes the piece. Yahoo users were recently affected by a malware ad that slipped through the multiple companies that handle an ad before it finally gets to the user. Adding to the problem is that the malware is capable of passing through antivirus software undetected. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOntW_KG4OyIttXZcPVgUaaTz8PONyHJi_5IFN1HWvy9omUJXDTbvGjlFdbCi9kvV9ECpThKB2BaFrf4w0x3aioycka5BuQzvyCQsU-v-QuBO6nsxTCS-N1FGCmPo_fWvmDVrHUxRWhMlc6k9Gbw0dnfgsEBVKVBAm521-1gzvrZR-RUoIZks6NZ-Ycd-R0Q7fNEruSN7pgmRRURY5mFRAYymxpj7ETGIMEfG7OgGNiq-OQ==> .


Two Sides Of Every Story


A report published last week by Ben Edelman criticizing the advertising practices of video ad company Blinkx is under scrutiny after Edelman disclosed that he was paid for the report. Shortly after publishing his analysis, stocks in Blinkx took a plunge, but there are several hedge funds that would have benefited from such a decline in price. Edelman has not disclosed who paid him for the report, or why, but he maintains that "the work stands on its merits." Read on <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnuj10pgDbA4u3RQ0t14S0TIZR6nCP0_qKsnbPqpBsa1ePoy_hkTIuFSHmF0vnU0EBRcLE4m4tb6QVuCs50OXJJiSvOJYWRN7ShPXvtHkZ8XPkv0SLetQwf06W9VK40jlbBCn11GT6dA6-yQ_opnk1Pc3DuC45goWf3kqVa5FHH2ARI7Kvl3OfOkUCEYCEKNd7ddZnzKdpoJ_g3GD0HSRi-tB2wUGTl7n2wflKvIVrFygwOvXrpSpO90w7aqoZPtOe2UDJHqnYmRkd75TTTFOpz8> .

Sales Departure


Microsoft's VP of sales, Keith Lorizio, has left the company, Adweek is reporting, but no reason was given for his departure. Lorizio has worked for the company since 2006. Microsoft said in a statement: "We can confirm that Keith Lorizio, VP of U.S. sales for Microsoft Advertising, is no longer with the company. Barry Dougan, GM of global specialist sales, will assume interim leadership of the U.S. ad sales organization while we conduct a rigorous and thoughtful search for a permanent replacement." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?e=001roOhmDfeOnt2lUh1459tvJJ3Zsf1oUpBknZRM9nAbN0YXhVbODn6UIKGw1-kvW_A5Y9Zr0NZHG6KeEgI9IG1AawcJdjTkSEqjHI26K98_PNofIkKyIKq6RWrOEAamdseGrMU_cfhzpRI-_CXm5SOMqGPlQi7dYZbhOfD0wqiuVvv0sUH2NJ6GHjghnfhKoWToPZXkJe0TBg=> .
